review: An absolutely stellar game, one of my favorites of all time. Music, visuals, and writing are all top-notch; oddly enough, the gameplay is the weakest part of the package in my opinion, but that's not due to it being bad so much as it is everything else being incredible. Highly recommend picking it up, and especially recommend checking out the still-ongoing webcomic that takes place after the game's good ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114700367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1688771677}
review:
Pues es un juego bueno.... PERO pudo ser algo mucho mejor.
La idea de controlar un villano que rapta princesas es sin duda algo muy interesante. Las princesas (y el príncipe) tienen su carisma, sobretodo Mayapple, que no llega a ser del todo una deconstrucción de Peach en plan Fiona de Shrek, pero tiene sus pros que la hacen un muy buen personaje. La idea de controlar los bosses en ves de al héroe es un concepto divertido, Crow, el malo, tiene su carisma y habilidades POTENCIALMENTE interesantes... Pero joder con los fallos del juego.
Lamentablemente este juego se siente muy amateur, algo que no debería considerarse producto final. Si, está completo, es jugable y no tiene bugs que rompan la partida... Pero tampoco es algo que merezca uno decir "buen trabajo".
La mecánica de atacar/disparar en base al puntero del mouse se me hace innecesaria e incómoda, con lo fácil y disfrutable que sería un control estándar de teclas, porque... ¿A QUIEN SE LE OCURRE QUE ES BUENA IDEA UN CONTROL CON PUNTERO EN UN PLATAFORMERO? Por no mencionar lo inútil que es la mayor parte del tiempo, en el final malo tiene su utilidad... Pero joder que es algo super incómodo de controlar.
Las físicas del personaje dejan que desear, Crow es un tanto lento en movimientos y el tema de rebotar con granadas es un maldito desastre, a veces no hay colisión y dependiendo de donde rebotes te puede mandar para cualquier lado.
El aspecto gráfico está un poco descuidado, algunos sprites in game dejan mucho que desear en contraposición a los diseños que muestran en sus cajas de diálogos. Por supuesto que no se espera la misma calidad... Pero por dios que algunos diseños como el Sonic abeja, Mayapple, Mack y por supuesto el vikingo entre otros se ven horribles.
Explayandome en eso, los escenarios se sienten muy vacíos y carentes de contenido, con un diseño muy pero muy básico y otro que depende del rebote de granadas (Y es un completo dolor en los huevos). Algunos niveles son decentes, como el del tren, pero hasta ahí.
En general los controles y el diseño se sienten como de juego flash y no de uno memorable. La música es un 50/50, y el aspecto amateur se deja más en claro cuando no saben hacer un bucle decente de música, notándose el corte de la misma en niveles.
Hablando de amateur, las transiciones son demasiado malas, las implementaciones de textos se vuelven tediosas cuando regresas a un nivel y volvemos a la historia en lugar de jugar el nivel normalmente ya que eso ya pasó. Al principio hay un uso decente de los recursos del juegos para presentar cutscenes, pero ese aspecto se va perdiendo en gran parte del juego.
Puedo entender que este sea un juego pequeño e indie (Y creo que financiado por Kickstarter si mal no se), pero no.... Una buena idea y un potencial juego que podría atraer la gente se ve muy limitado con estas falencias.
En si, no recomiendo de todo el juego, tiene cosas positivas pero se ven opacadas por una programación primeriza y básica, un diseño de nivel pobre y un estilo artístico inconsistente. Espero que el creador, de tener una segunda oportunidad, pueda aplicar todo lo bueno y más en un remake, la idea no es mala y este juego tiene sus virtudes, pero requiere un mejor trato en manos profesionales.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347411668', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1677860171}
review: The gameplay is solid, but the game's main strength is definitely the writing. The dialogue is full of clever jokes and cheeky references, and the characters are all very memorable and entertaining. The game repeatedly subverts player expectations. The only real complaints I have are nitpicks like most of the background music fading out at the end instead of looping cleanly, and the answering machine on the Sovereign not playing, neither of which actually affect the gameplay. Josh Hano even made music videos and is continuing to publish a graphic novel series continuing the story of Nefarious, and I just can't for the life of me understand why this isn't more popular.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043080705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1523, 'last_played': 1697253160}
review:
Nefarious es un videojuego de plataformas en 2D en el que controlaremos a Crow, un villano el cual tiene como misión capturar a las princesas de todos los reinos para llevar a cabo su plan maestro. Puede que esto suene muy cliche de videojuego antiguo pero lo cierto es que el juego lo hace a proposito, es consciente ya que el mismo es una parodia/referencia a varios videojuegos retro, con cada reino con su respectivo villano y heroe, dialogos que hacen referencias a la logica de los mismos, etc.
El gameplay es bastante sencillo, si buscas un reto pues lamento informarte que aquí no lo encontraras ya que no evoluciona mas aya de "Saltar, lanzar bombas ya sea para atacar o rebotar como si fueras Junkrat de Overwatch y dar puñetazos", mas si le sumamos el hecho de que el dinero que ganes en los niveles podras invertirlo en mejoras para el protagonista. Pero eso si, te encontraras con varios personajes carismaticos, y si bien su historia tambien es sencilla, sabe sacarle provecho del contexto y los personajes que tiene, ademas de que tiene su lado un tanto oscuro que le da seriedad al asunto.
Dependiendo de la princesa que capturemos, esta nos otorgara un power-up en su nivel para lograr superarlo, ya sea un salto mas alto o munición infinita.
Las batallas de jefe son inversas, con esto me refiero a que nosotros tomaremos el rol de jefe al final de varios niveles, cosa que tiene sentido ya que nosotros somos el villano, y si bien suelen ser sencillas las batallas y llegas a sentirte poderoso pues esa es la gracia.
El juego posee 2 finales, el cual dependera de unas decisiones que tomes en momentos concretos, no es algo de que preocuparse ya que si tomaste X decisión en X nivel, podras volver a jugar hasta llegar al punto de tomar esa decisión.


Como puntos negativos podria decir que:
-Al juego le faltan mas efectos de sonido ya que, por ejemplo, hay un momento de la primera misión en la cual estaremos siendo perseguidos por la policia, pero a pesar de esto, no hay sonidos que nos demuestre el caos que esta ocasionando nuestro personaje, esto es algo que sucedera frecuentemente pero bueno, al menos el soundtrack, el cual cabe aclarar que esta bien logrado, logra hacer de esos momentos algo mas epico o alocado.
-Su duración, ya que en una tarde libre te lo podras pasar sin problema con ambos finales, yo se que la calidad no esta definida por la duración del producto, pero es que con este mundo el cual posee muchas historias que contar (ya llegare a eso) es algo que puede llegar a decepcionar.
-El dibujado de los personajes, a ver, en mi caso no tengo problemas, pero aquí es cuando debo mencionar el webcomic, si, Nefarious posee un webcomic que funciona como secuela de uno de los finales del juego, dichos comics cuentan mas tramas con otros personajes, mas transfondo de su mundo como tambien de algunos personajes y posee dibujos de un muy buen estilo, sin duda Josh Hano (el creador de Nefarious) supo manejar de mejor modo el dibujo en el comic que en su videojuego.
-La falta de idiomas, en mi caso pude entenderlo bien, pero para aquellos que no lean el ingles pues se les puede dificultar a la hora de querer entender la historia o dialogos.

Datos extra:

-Josh Hano tiene un canal en Youtube con su mismo nombre, en dicho canal suele subir contenido de Nefarious, como por ejemplo 2 videos musicales los cuales son canon.
-Nefarious posee un sitio web en el cual podras leer su webcomic gratis, eso si, solo algunos tomos, si de verdad quieres apoyar a su creador y de paso, acceder a todos los tomos de su comic, puedes apoyarlo en su Patreon, no tiene perdida.

En conclusión, Nefarious no sera el GRAN VIDEOJUEGO DE PLATAFORMAS pero si es un juego que logra entretener y hacer reir gracias a sus dialogos, personajes y las referencias a otros videojuegos.

PD: Nunca suele estar en oferta asi que si te da curiosidad aprovecha que tampoco es que este tan caro, no tiene perdida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122610570', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1676920660}

author: {'steamid': '76561198359591927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1672113140}
review:
Charming nostalgia yet original game.

Story and characterization: 4/5

Without spoiling the game, you play as Crow who desire to kidnap certain characters for his own goal while fighting obstacles characters inspired by popular 2d 90s game characters. The game shine best when comes to characters interaction which takes place in hub place or levels. You do learn various characters situation and personality which can be funny, intriguing, character you want to root for, something that is sad, and WTF moment as well.
======
Gameplay: 3/5

Like megaman, you can customize your weaponry where one arm does punching ability which isn't that great to be honest where other arm can use 4 types of projectiles. The game does encourage you to use regular or sticky grenades to give you extra jumping boost to reach certain treasure chest (this is money), crowns, and vinyl records. Problem about this that you can't change weapons doing gameplay despite there are choices of using rockets and assault rifle which doesn't give you jumping boost. This would mean that you wouldn't use rockets or assault rifle until you finish the game. 

The game is generous to have saving point within the level and infinite lives. Since you are a super villain, you would interact with certain villains and get to use various machines on most levels. You can use 3 save files which can be convenient for those who are sharing the game. 

This game does something different compare to other 2d shooting games that I have ever played and that is using captives' passive ability to your advantage. Do note this passive ability isn't used often through out whole game which would have been neat idea if they did. 
======
Music: 2.5/5

Music is okay which nothing really standout but there are few very annoying music. Luckily this game does give you option change the volume of sound and music. 
======
Presentation: 4/5
I thought this game did good job for indie game where some are animated as well. Some characters needed to be updated for such as Mayapple does not look right when comparing her to other characters. 

Final thoughts:

I highly recommend buying the game and it does worth sequel

review:
Game is not particularly fun game-wise. I tended to rush through levels just to complete them, rather than explore. 
The plot and setting however, really hooked me in. Nefarious is not the kinda game you play because you want to play a fun video game. It's for when you want a new sort of story, and a video game just happens to be the medium it's being conveyed through. 

If you like the story, but dislike the game, they author has a comic series you can find around the internet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039948975', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1614196262}
review:
Lots of charm, sometimes a bit annoying, but some good writing and characters.
I like games with a hub like this where you can just talk to people between every level about dumb goofy stuff and get some extra bits and the like, and I really like how Crow still acts like a genuine villain throughout the whole game (even when he's befriending the princesses he's kidnapped)

One problem though is the upgrades are kinda useless.  Theres 4 punches and 4 grenades you can get but the grenade upgrades a useless cause you need the default grenade to grenade jump, and some collectables can only be attained using these.  You can get sticky grenades for bomb jumping too, but the other two upgrades removes your ability to grenade jump so you'll always leave them unequipped even after buying em (unless you're replaying a level).  The explosive and "Far reaching" punch upgrades also dont feel like they do anything unless you specifically got the chargable punch, so ultimately the upgrades feel like they're just kind of tacked on. 

Other than that, the levels are fine (some minor annoying areas but others have cool ideas) and none of the levels were annoying enough to stop me from playing to the end.  If you like games like Shantae and Double Cross, this should be right up your alley

author: {'steamid': '76561198173223783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1612118108}
review:
Rare were the games I played that had such terrible, uninstinctive controls. I got stuck on the fight against Dash because I had no freaking ideas how to control the Death Pod. I respect Eggman for being able to control such a terrible engine. I love the comics, but the game is definitely not worth it, unless you like painful maneuverability. I can't believe how infuriating the controls are. The only game that made me hate its controls as much as Nefarious was Getting Over It with Bennett Fody, and in that game, the controls were intended to be terrible.

I think I'll just go back to the comics and songs, which I really recommand to all of you. They're pretty cool.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258010138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1611225193}

author: {'steamid': '76561198134584318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1594322842}
review:
Amazing webcomics and an overall fun game.

The concept is charming, and there lots of neat details sprinkled throughout. 
The tone of the game and how the characters interact, as well as the fun mechanics and fresh ideas is some of what makes it so charming.
It's one of those, short and sweet games, with interesting characters and a compelling story that makes you want to play it all at once. 

…But, it does have some shortcomings. 
1.	The controls can be rather awkward at times, and the final boss of the 'good ending' is a pain to beat.
2.	Only a few of the dialog lines are voiced, even though I think the game could have been even better fully dubbed.

But, that being said, Nefarious is still an overall fun and charming experience, and though it has some shortcomings, it's still totally playable and a great game in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272924864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1588193672}
review: I'm not one to comment on many games, but I must on this one for it is truly a very unique game with a genre not many games now have. I like a villain protagonist and avidly look for games where you can play as them. While I am a primary fan of rts games and some fantasy, this one truly takes the cake. I knew about it before buying it as I have seen some videos on youtube and at first I was apprehensive on getting the game, until I explored it more. When I purchased the game I took my time with it and although it is not like most modern games, I found myself wanting more. Even when I had beaten the game I looked to see if there was more like it and I was somewhat crestfallen. I hope this developer and his team make a second game or maybe a spin-off. Regardless I will recommend the game even if any dislike the graphical style, it is overall a good game that was well thought-out and made to where you feel for each character.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073271053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1563022002}
review:
Now THIS is an indie game.

tl;dr: I wouldn't take this over Undertale or Hollow Knight, but it's charming. It's got good story/writing, but be forewarned of the below, and if you think you're skilled enough at platformers, give it a try.

First, the bad, the in-game sprites look like they belong on Flash games(okay, that's more personal preference than anything, but whatevs). Some tiles clearly do not connect seamlessly to other tiles(obvious in the level mapping for the Japan-themed level). Movement has that acceleration thing where you start at a snail's pace, then get to normal speed after 3 or so seconds(very annoying for platformers). Levels are unpolished, there are some breakable blocks that are just there; they just lead to a dead end. The main projectile is an explosive that has travel time, and also gravity fall physics, which you're trying to use against flying enemies that constantly move around while you're also trying to move around and jump to dodge projectiles (hope you're clairvoyant; You can replace the grenades with bullets, but you lose the only mobility ability that you have). Mediocre voice acting for the few scenes that have them. Instant death environmental hazards(there are checkpoints, though). Title screen options menu is slow to navigate, and doesn't have audio options for some reason; you have to start the game, and go through an unskippable cutscene before you can lower the volume. Found it hard to play with controller, so I recommend mouse and keyboard, but the camera tracks where you're pointing the cursor, which is weird when you're also trying to aim at an enemy, and needs some getting used to. Story is slow to start. So much references to other games, the main character looking like a Megaman boss is fine since he's a villain and all, but the mario references are just there for being there and there's also a sonic expy??? and idk just a minor gripe. Navigating the level select is rather tedious because it always starts you at the first two levels, then you have to navigate to the second and third screen every time you want to progress the game. The final stage has an orange background, which makes it hard to tell where the red cursor is, making it even harder to aim. BUT! BUT, BUT!

The good:
[list]
    [*]Other art assets look good. Especially the character portraits(artist is Gashi-gashi I think). Character designs are an A+ for me.
    [*]Humor starts getting good after the first two levels.
    [*]Doesn't have that awful ice-level slide that other games have. Also, infinite retries I guess is a good thing that not all games have.
    [*]Each boss and princess has a different gimmick for the short while that you're on that section. I think the quantity over quality approach for interesting mechanics helps more than harms in this case, for a short indie game like this (game can be finished in an afternoon or so).
    [*]Tagline for the gameplay: it's interesting once you get the hang of it (hit or miss)
    [*]The writing is good. The characters are an especially strong point. I just love the story. Definitely the strong point for this game.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198345617367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1402, 'last_played': 1562288571}
review: This game is a delightful platformer with a twist: You are the villain! With tight controls, solid level design, and interesting mechanics such as the reverse boss fights, [i]Nefarious[/i] is truly a breath of fresh air for the platforming genre. I'd also like to acknowledge the masterfully crafted soundtrack, done by none other than Matthew Taranto of [i]Brawl in the Family[/i] and [i]Tadpole Treble[/i] fame. My only complaint with this game is I still haven't gotten an S Rank on the final level. It's really difficult, to the point where I would almost request a patch to make it easier. But I'm no noob. Great work.

review: The gameplay and level design leaves a bit to be desired, but it's absolutely worth it to experience what I think is some of the best writing in any game I've ever played. This game earns my 5-star rating on that virtue alone. The story is somewhat deep, while still being true to the over-the-top crazy nature of the game, and the characters have beautifully-developed personalities that lead to hilarious and heartwarming dialogue interactions. Beautifully written from beginning to end.

review: Came across a song relating to this game by chance. Led me here and I'm really glad for that. Interesting concept with cool characters makes for a fun game. My only real complaint is with the grenade jumping. It's very tricky and led to me dying multiple times. Also the turn based boss fight wasn't working. It only let me choose orbital cannon regardless of what I picked and it never hit the hero I selected. Otherwise a very good game. Hope to see more with these characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198849834062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1561535771}
review:
Будем честными,у игр давным давно зародился стандарт. Герой побеждает злодея,хэппи энд. Но эта игра устала от этого и поменяла сценарий. Теперь злодей побеждает. Мне всегда нравилось,когда игры ломают рамки,создают что-то не стандартное и у этой игры получилось меня заинтересовать. 

Гейплей. Платформинг. Но не надо кидать игру в мусорку,если не любите такой жанр. Она приносит механику,похожую на Rocket jump. Дело в том,что у вас есть гранаты,которые можно кидать и бомбить местных вражин. И от местных гранат можно оттолкнуться. А если точнее-то вы пускаете гранату,и вас от неё отталкивает. Кароч сложно объяснить дыбилу как мне.

История. Вы-злодей-проффесионал. Кроу! У вас есть бесконечная взрывчатка,корабль,секретарь,злобный план и изобретения. Всякие роботы-хуёботы,робо-рука и т.д. Вам нужно 5 принцесс,что бы заработала машина судного дня. 

Поющие яки. Поющие яки,визитная карточка этой игры.

Пройдёмся по минусам и плюсам.
 
Минусы
1.Спорный lvl-дизайн. Он не лучший,спорный,местами он спорный,местами отличный,местами непонятная мразь. 
2.Игра пустая. Нет,не буквально. В ней есть что-то. Я про звуковое сопровождение. Что бы понять о чём я,надо выключить музыку. Вы услышите тишину...мёртвую. Вот пример-Первый уровень,босс. Густой авто трафик,город в огне,вертолёты,сирены. Отключите музыку...ничего. Пусто! Не подвезли звуков и это ужасно.
3.Проблемы со сложностью. 60% проходится на отъебись,или чуть сложнее. Лишь 2-4 уровня,где сложный платформинг.

Теперь по плюсам
1.История. Она нормальная,может зацепить,задумка интересная,просто норм кароч.
2.Персонажи. То,что держит эту игру на плаву-это калоритность персов,их взаимодействие друг с другом,местные шутки. Причина покупать игру по скидке или играть с торентов. 


Вывод.
Игра не лучшая,и заслуживает лишь 6/10. Увы,своих денег она не стоит. Я советую купить по скидке,или торент. В игре нету русского языка,вам будет сложно играть,если вы не шарите в английском на уровне училки. Кстати,я без памяти и забыл уточнить одну вещь.

1. Есть игра и комикс,события комикса происходят после игры. Важно знать. Есть русский перевод комикса,поищите,но он не полный,ибо отсутствующие главы только для патронов создателя.


По баллам-она тянет на 6/10,был бы лучший lvl-дизайн,фоновые звуки,ещё 3-4 часа гей плея,и игра тянула бы на 8/10. 


(Автор не хотел оскорбить всех людей,которые шарят в грамматике,не злитесь)

author: {'steamid': '76561198388476339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1528138961}
review:
"do you think i should play that?"
Quick answer: don't

Long Answer:
when i played it i felt like i was playing an.. unfinished game. i haven't gotten all the achievements, i could try to get them, but i can't get myself to do it.
the idea alone for this game was very cool, heck, it was one of the most important reasons why i bought and played this. but no matter how cool an idea is, it has to work in practice. this game itself is just wasted potential i'm not saying that this game is pointless, it presented a great world of "legalized" hero vs villain fighting with tons and tons of potential. i've seen a kickstarter for the graphic novel (book) of this universe and read some free parts of it and it's not that bad. but this game could work way better if it had different gameplay. the biggest and best characteristic of this world(to me) is its base idea, so a platformer, that shows you more action and parkour and less story isn't gonna go far. if developers gave more personality to their characters, more drama between them, more reasons and motives of characters to do certain things (why are they a villain, what are they gonna do after getting world domination, what helps them with goning forward), if they had shown us the rules and rights of this world, i would be way more interested in it and would look forward to that graphic novel and (eventually) future games. Unfortunately, creators gave us a mediocre (at best) combat system and tried to turn it into the rock and fundaments on which the whole game would stand (you're the boss of the stage, you have those giant death robots and you're the one using dirty tricks) so the game turned out to be mediocre at its best too. you are also very limited when it comes to choices. there are like 2 situations which dictate whether you get a good ending or bad ending (both of which are kinda out of place/ don't feel like what an actual ending would feel like) and close to none romance options (saying certain things on a tv show and getting a different answer after returning on your ship) which is the worst thing to happen to an idea with that much potential. if you have a simple, but great, one-in-a-million idea, which represents itself mostly with morals, you are OBLIGATED to let the gamers decide their fate. 2 endings are not enough for this. with that much potential in your idea you should easily be able to create 4 or 5 different endings to this game. and yet there's only 2. those aren't great endings aswell.


===Spoilers===
 the *bad* one is when you have the world domination, which was the plan of the protagonist all along, and the good one is when you get a *"Magical change of heart"* and decide that this is bad and you shouldn't do it. result very different to Crow's (protagonist's) hopes and dreams to say the least.
===No More Spoilers===


so, if you still want to buy this game, it won't be one you will remember very gladly after you end it.
 
Nefarious? More like I'M FURIOUS THEY WASTED SO MUCH POTENTIAL THAT WAS STORED IN THIS BRILLIANT IDEA

if you want a good platformer, that has a great combat system, can tell a story, has great and well written characters, and quite unique setting(s), with music that you can only love, check out Hollow Knight and Shovel Knight (very different games, both very enjoyable)! they both are better in at least 70% of all aspects of Nefarious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198952133234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1686257192}
review:
This game has clunky controls, and grenade jumping is got me killed a few times, but that is not enough to make me dislike this game. I love this game, it has fun characters and an excellent story. there arent many games that i would play over again in a short time, this is one of those games. the gameplay is not the best, and the creators know that, heck the sequel is a webcomic, they know that the story is the best part of the game. 
if a good story can excuse so-so controls, then have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117698564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 7623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5790, 'last_played': 1710432969}
review: I love this game, I've replayed it multiple times just for the boss fights alone! If anyone knows of any other good villain protagonist games, preferably one where you play as the boss, I would love to check it out! I would LOVE a sequel, but sadly the developer is only creating comics :(

review: Why be the hero when it's so much more fun to be the villain.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965990541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1550422615}
review:
Un jeu vraiment sympa, le personnage principal rappel fortement Laharl de la licence Disgaea, dans un style plus US et moins nippon (tant dans sa personnalité que dans son rire).

Si on juge le scénario pour son originalité, je dirais qu'il frôle le néant, mais si on le juge pour son humour, alors il est pas mal.
La difficulté est plutôt bien dosé (on ressent une hausse de difficulté sur la fin... Et si on va chercher "la bonne fin", alors il y a du challenge face au boss final).

L'OST est sympa également, il y a suffisamment de styles différents, pour que tout le monde aime au moins une musique d'un niveau.

Sur la durée de vie, le jeu m'as tenu environ 6h en faisant la mauvaise et la bonne fin. Je pense que l'on peut compter facilement bien plus si on cherche tout les secrets/couronnes/...

Dans tout les cas, l'expérience est plaisante, si vous aimez jouer avec humour les anti-héros (ou les vrais méchants ? :P ).

author: {'steamid': '76561197991729668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1545468247}
review:
It's not good. It's not bad. It's just... horribly frustrating. 

It feels like playtesting phase was just skipped.  As a result, difficulty would randomly jump up and down, damage from enemies easily can be ignored, upgrades does not make much difference, and you know you're failed your gamedisign, when player reads on upgrade "prevents you from rocketjump", and understands from it that all this time he could rocketjump.

Story is... accepteble. It's not good, autor's message [spoiler]"villans and heroes are artificial"[/spoiler] falls flat on it's face in first ending, and for the sake of making this message Crow, main villan and protagonist, is made into abomination with no internal logic or conflict.

So... game is not very enjoyable. But it's not too bad to refund or to not walk throw if you allready bought it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045971681', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1545106498}
review:
Satisfyingly challenging, fun, well written game. I laughed out loud many times. Good plot twists and good writing all around.
Although our protagonist is a stereotypical cartoon villain, Nefarious has a fun story with genuinely charming characters. The story reminds me of Undertale in some ways which is high praise. The gameplay is also fun and I was surprised to find that it has a certain amount of hidden depth to it.
Nefarious leans on the fourth wall constantly.  The story successfully draws lots of humor from absurd situations involving video game cliches, cool fantasy kingdoms and lots of punching and blowing stuff up. There are also moments where it gets a bit too real for a cartoon (in a good way) and the characters voice well thought out ideas. The cartoon fantasy kingdoms have to deal with complex politics. Most of the characters have rounded personalities and plenty of moral grey areas. There's some weird, disturbing science fiction moments. There's emotional moments. The 2 endings thing is cliche but this game handles it well enough, and the "true ending" is a blast.
The gameplay takes from the oldschool platformers and adventure games Nefarious is a parody of, but it also feels modern with things like 360 degree aim. I'd call myself a veteran gamer at this point and I am happy to report that the difficulty is not too easy or too difficult. Death will happen but it's made much easier by frequent checkpoints and there is no "lives" system to hold you back. If you want to be a completionist you'll want to beat the levels without any deaths (and find some secret items) which raises the difficulty more than enough for those who want it. There are some fun techniques with bomb jumping and you'll have to learn lots of enemy patterns and not fall in pits.
I recall seeing reviews pointing out some mechanical flaws, particularly in the janky boss battles, but personally this part of the game doesn't bother me. Any time a game has a unique mechanic used for only a small portion of the game there is a risk of it being under-developed, but I thought the boss battles had just enough to them to still be entertaining (even if they aren't that hard) which is precisely the point. Being the boss battle is FUN. (I might be biased towards liking the bosses though, I'm a HUGE fan of physics engine gameplay).

Of course I have to reccommend this game. Short as far as gameplay hours, but it packs so much quality in to a short game that it is worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198828799070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1584494983}
review:
This game may be one of the most interesting platformers I've played in awhile and has a great story. The clunky controls we something I got used to, though I personally recommend using a controller. My main issue with it is that it's just too short at full price. I find an hour of gameplay per dollar I spend shouldn't be too much to ask. If you plan on doing a full completion of the game, then you'd probably get a good 20 hrs out of it. Just doing story blind took about 8 hrs, but that's just me.

Overall, I'd say wait for a sale, but a great game nonetheless.

review:
A game that has a unique take on the generic story of heroes and villans, the gameplay during the stages is tough but worthwhile, the boss fights are based on boss fights from other games in the past and the music is nice to listen too.

Overall, I say that it is a game worth the price asked for.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994659197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1542978829}
review:
I backed this game on kickstarted because I really liked the concept and story. Sadly, the game itself failed to live up to those things, but at least the webcomic has been entertaining thus far.

The game feels SUPER unbalanced! The attacking feels incredibly sluggish and imprecise, platforming feels floaty and unpredictable, and the enemies waffle between being too dumb to live and irritatingly impossible to hit. Particularly in the second level with the groups of floating bee enemies that you can only hit with extremely slow and imprecise grenade projectiles while they spam you with their cheap projectile attacks.

Bottom line. If you want a fun megaman-ish game, go play 20XX.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031826170', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1643880697}
review:
Gameplay wise? It's a simple and fun sidescrolling platformer. Decent controls and lots of things for the crashings and the smashings.

What really stands out is the writing. This game tells a good story with sharp jokes and fun characters with great lines!

Game's got some good music too. I like the Hearless Abyss, but the character dialogue really stole the show for me.

It's worth buying if only for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082401360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1537034196}
review: Good concept, but realization just doesn't correspond with my expectations. I don't wanna say that gameplay is bad: it is ok. It feels like clunky minimalistic Megaman a bit, but ok. author: {'steamid': '76561198112074063', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1147, 'last_played': 1694186487}
review:
I really tried to like this game. I tried my absolute hardest to enjoy it. The concept was amazing, the characters were good. But the storyline? The length of the game? The gameplay? There's no nice way to put it, I'm sorry. But it absolutely sucked. 

The difficulty felt completely artificial. Whether it's swarming the screen with endless enemies, positioning enemies so that they constantly knock the player into instant death pits, the [i]OVERABUNDANT AMOUNT OF INSTANT DEATH PITS[/i], and the fact that the hitboxes for the enemies are extremely off. The machine gun can fire for multiple seconds straight through some enemies without harming them, as an example.

As for the boss fights, (the part of the game I was most excited for) they absolutely sucked. First off, the ranged weapons can down some of them in literally 3 seconds. And each boss fight, while it has a nice reference, has a major problem with it:

The first boss fight, where you pilot a vehicle similar to Eggman's wrecking ball, was the one I was the most excited for. And yet, it misses the point. The game was advertised as allowing the player to pilot these things against heroes. Except they gave all the heroes basic boss battle characteristics, making it feel less like playing as the villain and more just playing an unconventional boss battle. As for the fight itself, the hero can't shoot unless he builds up a pillar beneath him. And while you can hit him for a little tiny bit of damage, hitting the tower underneath him makes him fall down and stuns him for a long time. This mechanic seems odd. Hitting the tiny target on top deals chip damage, but hitting the massive tower underneath him once opens him up for attacks? Shouldn't it be the reverse?

The next boss is Dr. Mechano. Although, he's more of a midboss. He pilots a flying vehicle and you can only hit him by bouncing up the wall and punching him... At least, that was the idea. As usual, they forgot about the grenade launcher and machine gun. Since they didn't put invincibility frames after the enemy gets hit, you can just spray your gun and kill him in about 5 seconds. 

Next, let's talk about the giant mech fight against the viking hero. Once again, it sucks. The entire fight breaks down to "punch randomly and occasionally hold left or right to dodge". And it gives you SO MUCH TIME to dodge the attacks, making it a joke to win, except for one tiny thing. At least when I played it, it seemed to forget to tell the player you can hold left and right to dodge the attacks. As such, I was stuck trying to use the punch to dodge, until I accidently figured it out. Maybe it did show the left and right arrows and I missed it, but regardless, some labels as to what the buttons did would have helped. Terrible tutorial aside, the fight is just boring. Like I said above, you punch, punch, dodge an extremely telegraphed attack, punch

Continuing, we have the RPG boss fight. This one got me so excited when I saw it. Playing as the rpg villain? AW YEAH, LET'S DO THIS!... Until I realized you have only 2 attacks and each hero only has 1 attack. Basically just grenade launcher twice, then orbital cannon whoever doesn't get healed. I don't even want to talk anymore about that fight, it just makes me upset about it's wasted potential

Next, we have the fight against basically the Mechazord. Although, you're not in a giant robot yourself, instead being in your normal state. You know what that means! The grenade launcher or machine gun downs it in about 5 seconds!

Following that, we have a mecha godzilla suit against Mack! No way they could make THIS suck, right? WRONG! Mack only moves up and down at the same rate for the entire fight, and fires very slow shots. You can't actually shoot on demand, instead you fire after blocking about 3-4 shots. The problem with this is, if an enemy is moving up and down with no deviation in speed or turning point, you can just follow his position with the arm and block every single shot. Boring AF

The next few fights are just repeats of previous boss fights, no need to say anything here other than that they still suck

Now, we're getting to the end. Spoiler alert ahead!








Still here? Alright then. 
You pilot the Doom Howitzer against Hyper Mack, and... Well, you already know what I think of it. It SUCKS. Although I like the idea of having your character have 3 phases, it's pointless. You can't die or kill Mack in form 1 or 2, so the fight only starts at form 3. When it does start, you have full movement, tons of health, and a laser that downs mack very quickly. I would like to mention, while this happens you're getting attacked by hordes of mini-bots that seemed pointless at the time. The fight itself is kind of bland. Mack dies easily, it's nigh impossible to be hit if you keep moving, and touching Mack with the ship damages him.

Now for the true ending boss fight. THIS is the one thing about the game I didn't completely hate. You fight AGAINST the boss you were controlling in the normal ending. And the tiny robots from before? They're used as projectiles against the boss in the true ending fight. I did really like that little touch. 

As for the true ending itself, THAT was the one thing about the game I liked. Normally in games where you control the villain, he conforms and becomes the hero. While Crow DID perform a heroic action, he stays as a villain. I really liked that break from the status quo.

Although, one problem. Can a good ending save a bad story? My stance is unfortunately no. Although, I'm not here just to mindlessly complain. This was a kickstarter game, and it's obvious they tried their absolute hardest to make this good. So, I'll leave here some suggestions I have that I personally think could make the game better. If the devs want to include any of them, that's fine. If they don't care and like the game the way it is, that's fine too. After all, it's their game, if they enjoy it more this way then I'm in no position to judge them.

First, the boss fights need more variety. In traditional boss fights, the player (controlling the hero) and the boss itself have a wide array of attacks and weapons to use. Having both the boss and the hero have what boils down to only one attack is a major problem with the game. Also, maybe patch the issue with the gun hitbox and the ability to down bosses in 5 seconds with the gun

Second, focus a bit more on enemy placement. While having flying enemies with homing attacks placed right by death pits will kill the player, that's just artificial difficulty. It's just not fair to place enemies so they pop up around the screen border and knock you into instant death pits. Btw, maybe tone down on the death pits. They're literally everywhere

Third, the final boss fight (non true ending) has no closure with Mack. He gets shot, and it cuts to The Doom Howitzer opening fire. I feel like there needs to be a scene with Mack actually talking inbetween him getting shot and that cutscene. The change felt so abrupt, and could really use that little bit of padding

Finally, I'd like to see an extended DLC story at some point or at least a DLC with more things to do. The game has so little content, and honestly isn't worth $15. It's barely worth $5

In conclusion, I don't think the devs were lazy. They tried their hardest to make this game what they wanted, but it's filled to the brim with problems! If they fixed the endless problems, I'd be more than willing to change my review. But at the moment, (as much as I really wanted to love this game) It's absolutely awful. 

Honestly wish I didn't give this game a chance to prove me wrong, since I can't even get a refund now. If you start playing the game, and don't like it, the rest of the game is even worse so don't try to give it a chance. Just get your refund and buy a better game. 

Not a coincidence that at the moment, the top 4 reviews are 2 negative and 2 positives who got the game for free anyway. SMH 2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995051730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1531950027}
review:
Unfortunate, really. 

I like the premise. I like the characters. I love the music videos they made for the game (which made me buy it in the first place) and after I finished the game, I ended up reading the webcomic. Honestly, everything about the game is pretty good – except the actual GAME part of it. 

There’s no going around it – the game’s horrible controls make it very annoying to play through. It’s generally easy enough that you can do most of the levels with only a few deaths, so it’s okay. 
EXCEPT for the final boss fight in the good ending. Jesus Christ. Precision punching things with almost nonexisting hitboxes into moving targets is not easy, and the controls WERE NOT helping. I ended up forcing myself through it out of sheer spite, and I gladly banished the game from my drive afterwards. 

Which is why I can’t really recommend it in the end. Probably better to watch a Let’s Play, than to play it yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191263043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1531656016}
review:
Случайно я нактнулся на (Nefarious Volume 1: "Bad Guy's Gonna Win").И был сильно заинтересован.
Nefarious - это двухмерный платформер со злодеем в главной роли.
Главный "злодей"-Crow.(Ворон).Строит роботов,похищает принцесс и пытается захватить мир.Соблюдает злодейские правила,как можно не рассказать свой коварный план герою?Да и просто он BAD.
 И так мир достаточно интересен и карикатурен.Геймплей скучноват,но уровни проходятся быстро.
Нужно отдельно отметить музыкальное сопровождение.Музыка сделана хорошо.
Довольно сложная механика с прыжками и бомбами.Мы выступаем в качестве босса и в игре присутствует юмор.
Но была одна черта,которая заставила меня поставить эту игру в любимое и написать обзор.
Это-очень запоминающиеся персонажи.Просто общаясь с ними ты привыкаешь.В них словно вложена душа.Половину диалогов не понял,а уже такой эффект.Если сравнивать в каких еще играх персонажи были настолько живыми то кроме undertale ничего в голову не идет.
Самое обидное для меня-это не поддерживается русский язык.Человеку который может сказать свое имя и узнать местоположение на англ. было очень сложно.С радостью перепройду,если выйдет руссификация игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112419425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1533601231}
review:
I'll go ahead and say that I got this game because I supported the creator on Patreon.

Have you ever wanted to become the villain? Well, now you can. And while I haven't beaten the game yet(I'm close as of the time of writing this review), the game in and of itself is rather fun. There are some issues, such as grenade hopping, but the game more than makes up for it thanks to it's charm, amazing visuals and music, and humor. I highly recommend giving this game a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216168788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1486157876}
review:
I got this game awhile ago but just now decided to review it.
I loved this game to bits when I first heard of it, and I still somewhat enjoy it, but my mains problem are ones that many had.

The gameplay/controls. Also buggy.

Wouldn't recommend a mouse and keyboard for this one. Couldn't get past the first actual boss because of it. Controls are very slidey, loose, and faintly delayed (that may just be my computer but ya know). 
The bugs are also a bit annoying. While fighting the first boss I ended up shoving him into the floor somehow, making the fight unable to be won or lost.

The rest of the game, however, from the characters to the story to the art design is absolutely amazing. I recommend it just for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104859700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1374, 'last_played': 1685505526}
review:
An amazing game, truly under-rated.

Seems like hints from Megaman, Metroid, Sonic and Final Fantasy were thrown into a blender with a hint of purple.

I'd recommend this game, but it could do with being on sale from time to time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116026182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1529474504}
review:
Fun game!  There is a lot to love here, the concept is unique, the art is good, and personalities of the characters via the dialogue is a lot better than I expected.  The format of having a hub area helped enhance the experience.  

The gameplay is not as polished as other platformers, but is workable, and the level of challenge was higher than I expected, but for the most part still felt fair.  Some of challenge is in working with the controls, but it made the game more interesting for me. 

The cursor is not always easy to see against the backdrop of the stage, and the bee hero has an annoying homing attack that didn't seem dodgeable, but aside from that I enjoyed the experience.  The dialogue was witty and surprised me more than a few times.  The mechanics are interesting because the camera moves slightly with the mouse, and made for a more challenging/interesting gameplay experience then simply pointing and clicking to shoot/attack, as the camera and character movements alter the position, plus your grenade shot has gravity and a short range.  

I'm happy to have kickstarted this project, it turned out much better than I expected it would be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008583885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1528388100}
review:
Nefarious is a fun side-scrolling platformer, that reverses the classic roles of villain and hero. The protagonist, Crow looks like he'd be right at home in the Classic Mega Man games, with his design. The game play is the traditional jump and shoot, but with other modern additions like grenade jumping, similar to the Plague of Shadows Campaign for Shovel Knight. The levels aren't overly long, which keeps the story and game flowing along nicely. Even with completing the additional side-missions the game took me about 5 hours to complete. But I was having so much fun, it hardly felt like it. 

The protagonist and supporting characters get fleshed out pretty well, as you play through the story. You'll face off against various heroes and rival villains as well. Combating them in unique boss battles, where you control the mechs and robots that you would be fighting against in almost any other game in this genre. I also have to comment on the music, it's very energetic and keeps you engaged in the action. Each level has its own unique music track to listen to, which you can also listen to on board Crow's airship, which you can use to visit each level. You'll also be able to purchase upgrades for Crow on the airship as well, letting you swap out different abilities. 

Overall I can happily recommend this game. Especially if you're a fan of side-scrolling games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198831732057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1528747803}
review:
Good concept. I actually feel indifferent to this game just lke every other game I've played except Xenobblade Chronicles 2, and I hate that fact. I want to be able to feel emotions about the games I play, but this one still doesn't make that happen.

*UPDATE* Welp, now I've finished it, and I can now say that the concept is still good, and it's also witty as all helck, but it's pretty short, and thus not worth $14.99. The janky kang controls weren't much of a problem exept during the Dash fight and the good ending's filal boss. I can't belive that they didn't let you change the controls for the buttons that make you go up & down. I had a hard time with Dash because I didn't know that you could move up. Only found out by mashing buttons during the start of the Heartless Abyss or whatever it's called.


(Also, at one point, Crow says that the only people who don't like dragons are crazy people, and I have never agreed more with anyone, fictional, evil, or otherwise, on any subject ever. That statement that Crow made is the most true and agreeable thing that will ever exist; I CANNOT stress that enough.)

review: I recommend this game to all of my back-stabing, pickpocketing, laser-shooting, demon-summoning, empire-ruling, hero-fighting, world-conquering 'friends'! This game has a lot of charm, personality, minions, princesses, plot-twists, and EXPLOSIONS!

author: {'steamid': '76561198232952132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1500168505}
review:
I was torn with this review. On one hand, I like the concept and there is a lot of heart and charm in this game. On the other hand, the gameplay itself is a clunky mess. The controls feel awkward, and the "reverse boss battles" are utterly unsatisfying (except for the final boss). The music is nice, but the sound effects feel like someone is clanking pots together instead of lending to the experience. Its not a terrible game. Its just VERY unpolished, and it shows. 

In the end, I'd give it a 6/10. It killed time and gave a few chuckles....but there are a lot of other games with charm AND good gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285188897', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1607197479}
review: I watched youtube videos about it yet it still feels fresh and immersive, I mean, your a villain who takes over the world with some of the most cliche actions ever done by other villains, though the way some areas of the game were done just feels like I've be trolled, like placing enemys near a bunch of grenade jump areas that requier pin point pricision, and the bosses were easy, though the fact you PLAY as the boss more than makes up for it. This game is fun, aside from a few cheap deaths and easy yet unique bosses, recommend it to platformer fans and people who wish to play as the bad guy. I give it 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198334614972', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1554489223}
review: So I've been feeling like playing this game for a while, Almost to 11 months but the price and the lack of discounts kind of turned me off it for a while, why play a game that's 10.99 when I could pick up 2 for the same price right. If you are looking for a even medium sized game, you aren't going to get it here, the main camppain is only 4 hours, max which can feel like you've wasted 10 pounds (I'm british as you can clearly see old chaps). Also the bomb jumping from the bomb blocks is also annoying, but those are my only complants with the game! The story is nice, the characters are full of laughs, the Bomb Parkcour (which Crow shoots) is fun and opens alot up for Speedrunning, the music is awesome and most of the bosses are fun and pretty darn easy so you feel like a supervillian! (not the russian guy though, he's not fun). The game isn't hard and you'll like die one or twice or over 50 times in my case, but since you instantly respawn I think it's fine, it makes it alot less tedious than it could off been, that's for sure. (the only time when I don't think this is the case is in the True Final Boss, and that's all I'm gonna say about that) Overall would I recommend this game... Yes but only in a sale or if you want to support the makers, it's fun, but the length pulls it back from being a masterpiece in my eyes, maybe just 3 more princesses would have sweetend the deal but I'm no game devolper. This game gets an 8.5/10 from me! Also I didn't have a problem with the controls but that's just me

author: {'steamid': '76561197989795433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1520801834}
review:
It pains me to say this, especially after supporting the kickstarter campaign and waiting like 3 years to play it, but I didn't really enjoy this one. 

[b]Nefarious is well drawn, well animated, features great music and the rare storyline about the villain as the protagonist. [/b]

That said, it was [u]very poorly executed in terms of controls.[/u] I'm not sure if it was because of poorly coordinated hit-boxes or overal poor response time, but throughout the entire game I found myself frustrated by the lack of precision control. 

[b]For example:[/b]
[list]
[*] Slipping off or falling through platforms
[*] Enemies phasing through my attacks and projectiles
[*] Getting hit by projectiles that didn't touch me, THEN falling to my death due to momentum loss
[/list]

Additionally, the kludgy controls exacerbated the final levels of the game, which featured a [b][u]STEEP[/u][/b] climb in difficulty. 

And while I don't regret supporting indie developers, I cannot recommend this final product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118737666', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1511516676}
review:
[h1]Nefarious-хорошая задумка, плохая реализация. В общем, как обычно...[/h1]
[u]В чём соль[/u]? В том, что [b]ПРАКТИЧЕСКИ ВСЕ[/b] [spoiler]но не абсолютно все[/spoiler] битвы с боссом сделаны наоборот. Как это? Ну [b]ТЕХНИЧЕСКИ[/b] вы босс, а предпологаемый босс-это герой. Интересно и заманчиво, неправда ли? Но это только битвы с боссом! Остальные же уровни будут как в обычном платформере. [spoiler]Ну как обычном, немного криворуком, но всё же таким же типичном.[/spoiler]
[h1]Геймплей[/h1] Он может быть как интересным, так и нудным. Плохо только то, что практически все интересные места показали в трейлере, а о типичном нудном прохождении уровней нам упомянуть забыли. Да, геймплей я могу оценить как [u]неплохо[/u], но это общая его оценка. Как уже было сказано, геймплей в разных местах разный, и играешь ты только ради сюжетных и геймплейно-интересных мест. Но всё это как и полагается в старом 2D платформере приправлено нудятиной из долгих хождений по уровню. Я ничего не имею против этого клише, но на дворе был 2017 год! Можно было хоть как-то разбавить эту скукотищу. В итоге особого впечатления от игры в целом не остаётся, остаются в памяти только эти прекрасные коротковременные моменты.
[h1]Дизайн[/h1] Мягко говоря-не очень. Идеи дизайна для уровней и персонажей может быть и хороши, и в тему, и приятно глазам. Но реализация как всегда отстаёт. Убогий дизайн и рисовку персонажей можно понять только посмотрев на лицо ГГ и сравнив с портретом. Дизайн уровней такой же как и геймплей: нудный, неинтересный и кривой. А ведь могли неплохо так атмосферки и красоты подбавить за счёт него, ведь как уже говорилось, основная составляющая игры-уровни.
[h1]Сюжет[/h1] Я спойлерить не хочу, по этому особо о нём рассказывать не буду, могу только переписать описание игры из магазина стим. Но могу сказать, что это [u]сильная[/u] часть игры. Он действительно, в отличии от дизайна и геймплея, интересен, а самое главное ещё и [u]комичен[/u]. У каждого персонажа есть свой ярко выраженный характер, своя история и своя часть клиширования. Но почему клише является положительным аспектом игры? Потому что данное клише и создаёт ту самую комичность и яркость персонажей, и вследствии этого их черты характера очень хорошо раскрыты.
[h1]Саундтрек[/h1] Особенного ничего сказать не могу. [b]Чистый среднячок[/b]. Он не настолько крут или ярок, как например в Undertale, но он просто подходит под ситуации, и его можно слушать. В нём тоже есть своя степень клишированости, но это плюса ему не даёт.
[h1]Арты[/h1] Это единственное, над чем разработчики [spoiler]если их можно так назвать[/spoiler] решили постараться. Портреты персонажей выполнены на высшем уровне. Но это всё не придаёт игры завышенной оценочки, поэтому эта часть не так интересна. Я её упомянул просто потому что она [b]ВЫДЕЛЯЕТСЯ[/b] на фоне всего остального.
[b]Итог:[/b] Игра уж точно не стоит своих денег. Да, она стоит хоть каких-то денег ради сюжетки и просто классных моментов, поэтому если уж очень сильно хотите [strike]пофапать[/strike] посмотреть на арты персонажей или влиться в сюжет, то покупайте по скидке не меньше 50%. А так 350 рублей это не стоит.
UPD: Если есть ошибки в тексте, то мне как-то похуй, я не граммар-нази. Но если кто-то нашёл, то буду рад, если укажат в комментариях на ошибку, и я её исправлю.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350816952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1518949637}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041224560', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1555291969}
review:
Classic platforming and lovable characters that poke fun at classic hero/villain tropes. 
Plus those "reverse boss battles" - where you play as the villain in the giant mech crushing the tiny hero - are incredibly satisfying!

My single complaint is that in one of the possible endings, the boss fight is really REALLY not fun. Can't really say more without spoilers, but I ended up quitting and looking up the ending cinematic for that one on youtube.

One unfun part in a sea of enjoyable gameplay. Still a great game that I recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198425226655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1620994133}
review:
Wow, finished the game in less than seven hours and I have to say: [b]WORTH IT![/b]

Let start of with the villain protagonist concept. Yes, there are just a handful of games that is fully dedicated to this concept, and most of them follow a 'dark humor/satire' theme like Overlord. But this game went even past that, with its loyalty to traditional video game villain tropes and nudges to classic video game villains. 

Next, the very much endearing characters. From the ever witty and villainous criminal mastermind Crow, to the always loyal and surprisingly effective minions, I assure you that you'd end up loving most of the characters. The prince(sses) all have their own little personalities, your secretary is an endless source of good banter and professionally funny dialogue, and even the heroes are characters you'd just love and love to hate cause they're heroes! The only concern I actually have for characters is the lack of depth of the special minions since they seemed to have so much potential. 

Gameplay. I'll be honest, the gameplay was very annoying and hard to master. It seemed to require greater skill than non-rage 2-D sidescrollers but when you do get the hang of it, it became manageable. Though I must warn you, there will be sections that you will curse with your entire being. 

Finally, the actual story. It started simple, having a humorous context and a nice villainous scheme to execute. Then as the game progressed, you got to look more into the different characters, especially Crow and Mayapple, and see deeper than just their face-value personalities. The game gradually became more and more deep, but it still retained its happy ambiance which just highlighted its best qualities. Finally, when you reach the endings, the game hits you with very emotionally satisfying (atleast for me) scenarios, which will leave you with a smile (nefarious or otherwise) as the screen returns to the main menu. 

All in all, this game no doubtedly has endeared itself to me and most likely stay in my heart forever since it pushed all the right buttons for me. The only actual downside with this beautiful game is that it doesn't have a sequel. And now I'm sad. Let me just ignore my sorrows by completing the achievements of Nefarious.
developer_response:
I'm very glad you enjoyed the game! While we currently have no plans for a video game sequel to Nefarious I thought you would like to know the story does continue in comic form over at our patreon. Where we have over 80 pages of content and growing.  https://www.patreon.com/JHano 

Thank you again for all your kind words! 

-Josh

author: {'steamid': '76561198018326356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1514675676}
review:
If you're going to take over the world with a giant superweapon, you might as well kidnap a few princesses while you're at it!

Nefarious is a run-n-gun platformer that flips the script by putting the player into the role of Crow, an over-the-top megalomaniacal supervillain with a horde of henchman and an evil scheme brewing.  As villains are wont to do, most of the game is spent invading various kingdoms, kidnapping princesses, and causing general mayhem as Crow's overwrought master plan comes to fruition.  Gameplay-wise this amounts to about ten straightforward levels of punching guards, flinging grenades, and surpassing platforming challenges while collecting money to obtain better punches and grenades.  The end of some levels even puts the player in the role of the boss fight against the local hero.

The true strength of this game is in its premise and characters.  It's an interesting enough subversion to follow the villain's adventure rather than the hero's, and Nefarious takes it a step further by really looking into what the everyday life of a comedic cartoon villain is like.  All the different characters have vastly different opinions of Crow and his villainy: some write him off as a two-bit wannabe, some skeptically tolerate his antics, some are just along for the ride, and a few genuinely try to get him to see the error of his ways.  Crow himself is all-in with his villainous persona and hams it up so much that it's hard not to laugh, even when he's actually succeeding, or accidentally doing something nice.  Throughout the course of the game the story actually gets surprisingly contemplative, looking into the philosophy of good and evil, the ends justifying the means, and what a "villain" truly is.

As much as it hurts to say, the weakest part of the game is the game itself.  Level design is uninspired and feels rushed, especially the boss fights; what should be a magnificent feeling of finally being at the helm of a giant death machine against the puny hero is reduced to simplistic dodging minigames.  Aiming projectiles is a chore with a controller and not much better with a mouse, and this combined with floaty controls makes the frequent bomb-jumping and dispatching of flying enemies very annoying.  A mechanic is introduced where kidnapping princesses grants a temporary special ability, but this mechanic is severely underutilized, occurring only once per princess in the whole game, and cries out for better implementation.  The majority of the problems present in the game seem to be hallmarks of the "Kickstarter Curse", wherein the project creators simply don’t have enough time, money, or experience to polish up the game the way they envisioned at the start.  Fortunately, they DID have enough time to invest in both visuals and music, which are as beautiful as they are thematic.

Not every game can be the full package, and Nefarious is certainly lacking in gameplay substance, but it just as certainly makes up for it with a whole lot of style and creativity.  Those to whom content is a deal-breaker might find themselves disappointed in this game, but to the rest, a fun and storied experience awaits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127754128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1535822640}
review:
I have not beaten this game yet; however I can already tell you that it's worth a look. In Nefarious you play as criminal mastermind/ serial kidnapper Crow as he attempts to kidnap all the world's princesses (and one prince). The game is dripping with satire and charm while placing you in a unique environment; the villian of a platformer game.

The gameplay is a typical sidescroller mold with collection elements so nothing new there. Once you capture the princess of the level however, you gain unique abilities from that princess (ex. A queen bee princess gives you a high jump, etc). 

This all culminates with the boss fights which flip the formula on its head; you are a villian in a platformer, i.e. you must do battle in the crazy mechs you see from this gerne and, let me tell you, I have new found respect for Eggman's Ball and Chain weapon! All of these are unique and fun to use, if a bit tough to learn at first.

tl;dr Nefarious is a unique little gem who places you in the shoes of a crazed evil mastermind on the quset to do what any good villian does; kidnap princesses. 

If you have the cash go ahead and give this game a shot; you may just be surprised.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131426856', 'num_games_owned': 1992, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1627376375}
review:
Ever wanted to sweep the dames off their feet, throw [strike]combustable lemons[/strike] grenades at the feet of your enemies, PUNCH PEOPLE WITH GIANT ROBOTS!?!? 

*ahem* Then Nefarious is for you. A fun little platformer that's short, but sweet. Taking inspiration from games of the past with the traditional 'hero saves princess, handsom hero gives chase, quest ensues* format, you put yourself in their shoes. 

I'd nearly compare it to megaman in terms of both appearance and mechanics, but it lacks to 'weapon get' and has a number of different mechanics. You can run, jump, shoot grenades (or bullets, but you can grenade jump), and punch. I'd highly reccomend using a controller for this alongside the shoulder buttons, as using the face buttons while trying to aim can feel a little janky. Speaking of jank, while the game as a whole is fairly easy or smooth so long as you're compitant, the final level and some of the optional levels can be quite frustraiting, even if you're familiar with the mechanics, due to a combination of RNG in some wierd cases and...akward extra grenade jumping while dodging enemies that knock you back. There's also a few bugs still in place, such as falling through the ground in an ice level, through the entire stage and into death in a large purple..place beyond the normal realm of the game. Aside from that and an issue in a lab-based extra stage, the game as a whole seemed bug-free.

The music, while it reuses the main theme a LOT is fun and jazzy and 'bad', and the artwork (be it sprite work, backgrounds, or art by Gashi-Gashi) is awesome.

Overall, I'd say the game is worth $10 rather than $15, but I'm more than happy to pay a bit extra to support the devs. I'm glad to have playtested this at more than a few cons (and discovered more than my share of bugs that they readily fixed), and am glad to have played the game. I'm looking foward to the graphic novel and anything else the devs put out.

review:
Jogo excelente!

E, somando-se a isso tudo, você é o vilão!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037147390', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1514553582}
review: It's a bit tough to decide between just thumbs up and thumbs down. The game is too short to justify the full price, especially for a 2d platformer, in my opinion. The controls get floaty but they're not horrid. The art differs greatly from portraits and promo, as they hired a different artist specially to make it more appealing. The settings of the stages mated with good soundtrack are certainly interesting, but the assets get reused sometimes too often (Crow's ship) and can be pixelated at times, especially in the case of backgrounds. However the story is charming, the music is decent. In my opinion the metacritic score is fitting. Up to you to decide wheter it's worth it for you, but looking back I'd wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970938672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1514093348}
review:
I like the style and intention of the game but ultimately I cannot recommend anyone go and play this game.

Basically outside of the "Boss Fights", it is your standard platformer. You can punch, fire grenades, andd occaisonally get a small little upgrade for a level thats lets you do things like jump higher or have you grenades leave a smoke trail in the air that lets you walk on it. But these upgrades are not around for very long which is unfortunate because they were kind of nice to have.

The boss fights are interesting and nostalgic but fairly simple and managed to go through the ones I got to fairly quickly.

But for a game with such simple controls it has a surprising challenge to it. Not because the levels are hard themselves persay but because the control scheme just isn't very well displayed or handled. There are these little pads that when your character is over them let you jump again. But the distance you get varies by how long you hold the button. I would normally like this but you can't really get an indication of if you did it long enough and most likely you insta die because you held it for to short.

Similarly I HATE the grenade launcher. So hard to tell whether or not it is charging up or not making it hard to hit the flying enemies leaving a really unsatisfying feeling.

The game is only hard because they made the controls awkward to use. I think the idea of playing the villan is cool, but the game just feels like a platformer with different style boss fights.

I tried playing it with a keyboard and with a controller and I absolutely thing a keyboard/mouse is better. Allows you to aim and gives more reliability to the direction of your punches and grenades. 

Also, I can never unhear the music in the Fire Ogre Princess' realm where it sounds like they are singing "I'm Mexican" repeatedly. Funny, and might be my favorite part of this ultimately forgettable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286453290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 362, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1513997998}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010203084', 'num_games_owned': 4630, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1496593985}
review:
A game that has its faults with some janky controls, but a game I find to be exactly what I want to see: a short and self-contained experience.

A 2-3 hour game with a silly and fun story and characters that does not overstay its welcome. A good game if you want something to fill time between other larger games. Hard to explain, really.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049559345', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3856, 'last_played': 1511465092}
review: Playing as the villain is a nice change of pace from always playing as the good guy.  What's even better is fighting those same good guys in "reverse boss fights" where you pilot machines and take down the heroes trying to stop you from kidnapping their princesses.  With a lovable and villainous main character, multiple endings, and challenging (and pretty solid) gameplay, what's not to love?
