author: {'steamid': '76561198145254584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1508828598}
review: An incredible game with a great story and sense of humour, with a kickass soundtrack to acompany it. If you're a fan of old-school 2D platformers, you will love this game. Do be warned however, while it is FUN, it's not EASY being the villain. Be prepared for a fair few deaths as you play. But in spite of this, I love this game to pieces, and consider it among my favourite of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198283193540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1503267127}
review:
This is a fantastic game. It had enjoyable platforming, fun & creative bosses, but best of all was the characters, you have to play the game to truly enjoy watching the characters progress through the story. I liked seeing all the ways this game differentiated itself from stereotypical games while referencing them at the same time (seriously, keep an eye or two out during the last level). Some of the levels are pretty hard, but once you get a handle on the controls, it's a welcome challenge, sometimes. There're also a great deal of secrets to be found in the game, which was a lot of fun to find.

But I do have a few gripes with this game. The first boss has a glitch where he disappears for no reason, forcing you to restart the level all over again, which was really frustrating for me. Worse still was that [spoiler] you have to fight him a second time [/spoiler]. It's possible to beat the boss, but it seems like there'll always be that chance of the glitch happening & making you restart. There's also a level with really hard platforming, & I think it's due to an error in the collision of the platforms.

Overall, it's an amazing game with some sizable issues, but those can be overlooked if you can manage to get past them. Definitely recommended. And side note, if you have the choice, you should probably use a mouse as opposed to a mouse pad cause it makes attacking easier when you have to platform at the same time. At least, that helped me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063624929', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1506302002}
review: I really enjoyed it. A fun little spin on "playing the villain" where the main character is desperate to stick with common tropes. Some pretty good jokes and challenging platforming but the check points have piss poor locations. The good ending is not worth restarting the boss fight over and over and over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202154811', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1511444429}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031477266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1506616472}
review:
I highly reccomend this game and always will. 

The gameplay was very fun, excellent platforming challenges mixed with an entertaining form of combat that made me look forward to replaying levels with missed collectables rather than dreading it!  Besides, Whats more fun than punching through anything that gets in your way? The reverse boss battles were probably the most entertaining boss battles ive ever experianced. They made me feel like for once i had all the power, as the bad guy rightly should.

The music was amazing, fitting to every situation and every area and really hyping me up to play the game. I listen to the soundtrack regularly when doing anything else, from walking, driving, and even playing it over other games. I also adore the fact that you can set the hub music to whatever track you like, so long as youve found the hidden collectable for it.

The story blew me away, it really made me enjoy myself as the villian, taking me through the other sided of the classic story of a captured princess, but with a fun spin! The characters were all great, not a sinlge one i hated outside of perhaps the one youre ment to hate. I cant bring myself to spoil anything here even for the sake of the review, serously you jsut have to see it for yourself.

If i had to force myself to name a flaw, its the only one i found, nd its not een big. pretty much whenever i use the grenades sometimes it does a long shot, even without me holding the button which can hurt grenade jumps on the fly. Really not a huge issue as the areas you need grenade jumps are mostly optional, and few and far between. So Yeah thats seriously no reason to take away any points.

In conclusion, this instantly became my favorite game of all time, ill be reccomending it to everyone i know for years to come and ill continue to support the dev on their patreon page. 10/10 imo, will ply again countless times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279384000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1516239951}

review: Highly enjoyable little platformer with humorous dialogue and situations. I laughed aloud more than once at their wonderful deconstruction of villian tropes. Controls are a bit floaty, but it's not too bad once you get used to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071891706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1504701426}
review:
A great testament to classic side-scrollers, using classic tropes and witty humor. It's like a cross between Shovel Knight (due to losing money when you die and the ability to pick it back up, and you can use your grenades for an added boost as well as attacking) and it's own thing. I used $10 to support the [url=https://www.patreon.com/JHano/posts]Patreon[/url], so that's why I checked the box that says I received it for free, 

There are some glitches, but I haven't encountered any that would hinder you in any way. On the contrary. In order to get a certain crown in a certain level you need to grenade jump across a certain lava pit. Normally it's very difficult, but you can also glitch through from above in order to get it, making it much easier. 

There are also two endings: The bad ending with an easy boss fight, and the good ending with the ridiculously difficult boss fight. Why is it difficult? Well, in order to damage the boss, you need to hit flying robots into the cockpit. However, it's the classic "the final boss has three forms" fight (which you take advantage of in the bad ending, as you are piloting the final boss). The first two forms are easy once you get the rhythm down, to the point where I ended up consistently only losing half a heart to the second form. However, it's the third and final form that sucks. It takes place in space, with both you and the final boss having full mobility. The way to take the boss down is the same across all three forms, but therein lies the problem: with both you and the boss flying about, everything is zoomed out, making it much, MUCH more difficult to hit anything, despite hundreds of drones available for you to hit at the boss. Your best bet is staying above and to the left of the boss while trying to knock drones onto the boss's head. 

Steam controller compatibility is top-notch, with one exception: the bad ending's boss fight. As you may know, the Steam controller has a trackpad. Now normally you aim and move with the joystick. But for SOME REASON, aiming is reserved for the trackpad for this fight, while the joystick is still for movement. Normally that would be fine, but whenever you try to aim, it keeps snapping back to it's original position instead of staying where you last pointed the cannon, which is what you fire during the bad ending boss fight. I ended up having to abandon the controller for a mouse during this section, which was way easier. 

Overall, I'd say this is a great 2-D indie game, up there with the likes of Mega Man (back in it's indie days) and Undertale (It's a great game, despite what haters think).

author: {'steamid': '76561198272276331', 'num_games_owned': 9, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1524437568}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005351852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1502656616}
review:
Alright, after chatting with others about games and stuff, I mentioned that I would like to have more games where you are THE villain and not just like other games where you can do whatever you want, I mean where you ARE the one who all are suppose to fear and hate, the one who is the stage boss or final boss of everything and one of them mentioned this one.

When I first time see this, I pretty much liked what I saw in trailer and decided to give a try and my first impression was that this kinda has voice acting in the game, but it is mostly just text.

So as you can see the design of the main character and some others are pretty much inspired from megaman and others and the art style is quite nice to look at, especially on Crow's character design (oh by the way, Crow is the main character)

As for the gameplay, it is good ol' platformer and you have to get to end of the stage for boss battle, but with one twist with battles, YOU are the boss of the stage and I was pretty much waiting for it to finally show other bosses how it's done for real.

Nefarious also has upgrades, but to be honest, you're mostly going to use just grenade launcher perhaps for entire game, only if you're trying to collect all stuff from stage.

Alright, let's just check all the Positives, neutrals and cons.

POSITIVES.

+ Interesting gameplay.
As I said and as you saw on trailer, you play as villain and as stage boss, than as another ordinary platformer where you just go there, beat the boss and save the world.

+ Artstyle
The artstyle is quite comical and perhaps even fitting for this kind of game, where you are as typical villain.

+ Story
I will say once again, I'm not good with story section, but this one has good one on comedy side, kinda reminds me Disgaea.

+ Music
As being villain, you need kickass theme... Or Jazzy one too.
I pretty much like Crows theme and some other theme as well, especially the final battle theme.

+ Being as villain
I don't think I need to explain why, but these kind of games are rare and I know you can be evil in other games like skyrim or other, but I mean being the absolute threat to the world, to be leader of  evil force, to be the villain in game.

NEUTRALS.

= Crow having a nose.
I dunno why I focusing on nose, maybe because, other doesn't have one or on main cover and mostly he doesn't have it and I kinda liked about his design, but it's a random thing that suddenly popped up and doesn't even matter on this.

= You need your first range weapon to get all collectibles.
I've used grenade launcher to get all crowns and vinyls, even if some part you don't even need it, but you still mostly use it.

= 12 hour gameplay.
If you do everything in the game, get all items and other levels, it is just 12 hour of gameplay or less if you're good at it, but it isn't that bad, it just depends your opinion how long gameplay it should be or so.

CONS.

- Less upgrades
You can almost get all upgrade on playing couples stage and getting all the credits that you can find.

- Jumping points almost ridicilous precision points
I don't know if you're struggling with these, those purples points that has bombs in it to make a jump, I had a great difficulties to manage those jumps, even with the controller, I still manage to fail to jump from them, because it feels like it is very precise on when you push the jump button.
Most of the times however, I manage to jump on them, but some reason certain parts just went for fail jump several times.
Still it might be just me or xbox one controller is derping around those parts.


Conclusion.
Nefarious is those rare villain games, which I want to see more, rather than those others where you can be "villain" if you want to, but is this game worth of your attention?
Well, it depends, but if you want my opinion, I say it is worth your attention, since after all, I am the mad scientist and an villain who just happens not having his own fortress... And minions... Or rival...

ANYWAY, that's all for now.

Doktor Greenman, logging out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983817188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1502582852}
review:
Once in awhile there is a "Very Positive" game that I have no idea how it earned it.  Of course that only out of 182 reviews so I'm pretty sure many people have never even heard of this game.  If you look on the internet, there really isn't a lot of praise for this game either (5.5/10 on destructoid)

This is not a good platformer.  The controls are very floaty.  You press a button and a second later your character punches.   
 There is no precision when you are shooting anything.  It's infuriating.  

There are fights where you are fighting waves of enemies for up to 10 minutes and you just wish you could move on because you're not having any fun.  There is simply no way to dodge the bullet storm they throw out at you.  The camera is also horrible as it zooms out so far, the characteers turn into the size of ants.  

I guess some of the appeal is that there are boss fights where you play the boss that are inspired by classic games.  Again, the camera pulls out so far that it loses any sort of feel for any of that.

I got this as part of my Indie Box subscription and it just shows me that not every game they pick is a winner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113434121', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1501436936}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973637497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1500541665}

The art direction is light and cartoonish, and the gameplay is very much an homage to metroidvania scrollers with bits of classic boss battles mixed in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268993308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1662078538}
review:
(I played offline close to 12 hours but Steam doesn't update time played so my 0.3 is a lie)

Gameplay: 6.5/10

Graphics: 7/10

Story: 10/10

Music: 9/10

A great twist on calssic 2D platformers, playing as the villain! The story is excellent and changeable (different endings) so you really feel immersed in the game. Playing with a controller can be difficult at times, and general control sensitivity can be rough. Difficulty spikes appear often, with one level being fairly simple and then the next being off the charts difficult. The sprites do look a bit strange and different compared to their "Chat Box" characters. The music is great and varies throughout the game. Overall 8/10 game, would play again

author: {'steamid': '76561198255402169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1588063796}
review: This game is great. The gameplay is awesome, the controls are decent enough, And the music is 10 out of 10. Though the real flaw of this is the bosses. It feels good to just sit in the mech and crush heroes. Exept from the 8-bit heroes, wich where kinda lame. The story is the best I've heard in a long time, and the intro: GENIUS!!! Though be wary that there are bad stuff with this too. For example frustrating difficulty and non-replayability. Overall, a very fun challenge with amazing soundtrack and great story!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046292061', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1499730877}
review: I got this Steam key as part of the graphic novel Kickstarter for the game. Let's just say I hope the book is better than the game. The gameplay is slow, boring, and just bad. The hitboxes are insane, there's a mechanic where when you die you lose some gold (because of course there is) but if you die in a bottemless pit you have to go to the exact spot you died which could very well be at the bottom of a pit...see the problem? You need money to get upgrades since if you don't have good upgrades the gameplay becomes even worse. This is sounding negative but I again I got the key as part of a kickstarter for a graphic novel and I am really excited for it because I loved everything about the world but a game can't rely on characters and settings to save it. In closing; boring game but a world I'd love to know more about.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078303294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1499946610}
review:
HHHHHHHNG is good game

gameplay starts out a litle nnnnnnnn but when you leanr to juggle yourself around with your grenades it gets really EEEEEEEEEEE

somtimes the visuals go a little HHHNG. Although this isn't enough to majorly retract from the overall experiance.

The plot and characters are AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
THE PLOT AND CHARACTERS AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
CREATIVE WRITING AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
DEEP LORE AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
PRINCESS MAYAPPLE AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

THE MUSIC GOES DOOT DOOT DEET DOOT BAP BOOM BOP and that's really great.

Although the game advertises the reverse boss fights more then anything else, I'd say they're probably the weakest parts of the game. Being generally sorta buggy and stiff. Fortunetly, they don't last long, letting you get back to the good parts of the game very quickly.

Overall, the game's a little rough around the edges in a few spots, but if you stick with it long enough (and remember to go for the good ending) it will do way, way, WAY, WAAAAY, more then enough to make up for it.







way's one of those words that stops sounding like a word if you repeat it enough







way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way way


And one last thing:

If you're using a controller, you can use the right stick to aim without moving. You can also can use the left bumper to jump.
Decause of how the controlls are set up, using these two methods combined means you can move in one direction, aim in another and jump at the same time, even with a controller. Very helpful for some of the harder stages in the game.

review: This game definitely delivers everything that a Villain Protagonist game needs. Well-designed reverse-boss battles, colorful characters and hilarious referential humor to other games and their tropes. The one flaw (besides random screen freezes) I have to mention is that most of the heroes you fight are not much of a challenge, but maybe that's just me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194716661', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1503152985}
review:
И так... После того как полностью прошёл игру я готов сказать, что не зря хотел эту игрулю!
Не смотря на простенький сюжет (не буду ничего о нём говорить чтоб не спойлерить), даже с учётом того что мой иглишь чуть ниже среднего, игра стоит своих денег. Почему? Сейчас объясню!
Сразу хочу отметить крутой музон который можно собирать походу игры, карточки которые автомотически добовляют один плюс,пасхалки навивающие настальгию, крутая ревёрсная (наоборот) система боя с боссами (ведь вы сами босс!), да вообще идея "глазами босса" показалась мне свежей.
Из минусов (о чём бы я не хотел говрить) хочется отметить не сразу понятную систему прижков на бомбах и маленькое количество уровней (я надеюсь это исправят)
Так же мне немного показалось странным довольно мультяшный вид персонажей вблизи (для кого плюс, для кого минус, но я отнёсся к этому нейтрально)
Чтож... Лично мне опять же игра понравилась и рекомендую в неё поиграть.
8 настольгий из 10-ти

author: {'steamid': '76561198277328125', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1498358478}
review: This game is what I consider short, sweet, and MAKES ME WANT TO FUCKING BREAK SOMETHING. See, the controls were fluid for me, breezed through the game and finished it in only 6 hours, but there are a few problems. One, the sprites aren't the best looking, but it's not bad by any means, it just doesn't blow you away like the cover. The biggest issue however, was the controls. Half the time they're tight, responsive and fun. The other half makes me want to shatter my monitor because of how many enemies you have to deal with at times, and might I add that the jumping sometimes wont work when you're in the invincibility frames. Is it a good game? Yes. An Indie gem? Perhaps. Perfect? Not. Even. Close.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156622388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1522458153}
review: This was a really great game in my opinion. I had fun, the levels were challenging at times, and I laughed at the dialogue here and there. It's really interesting, as well, how the game turns most of the hero-villain games on their heads by having the player in the shoes of the latter. The villain-villain rivalries, difficulties a villain has to go through to capture a princess, and reverse boss fights provide a different viewpoint than the norm. The game also includes upgrades, collectibles, and a few sidequests so as to make other objectives than just the story itself. It was fun, and I recommend it

author: {'steamid': '76561198056681931', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1497188396}
review:
Еще один проект, основной темой которого является взгляд на типичное героическое приключение со стороны злодея, в роли которого игроку и предлагается выступать. Однако если, скажем, Dungeon Keeper предлагал эту схему в декорациях фэнтезийного приключения в подземелье, а Evil Genius пародировал бондиану, то тут у нас имеется платформер и мир, живущий по законам Марио, Соника и прочей классики жанра.

Итак, наш персонаж - злодей Кроу, который очень гордится своим происхождением из потомственного рода злодеев. Он очень серьезно подходит к своим злодейским обязанностям: строительству гигантских роботов, похищению принцесс, сражению с героями и, конечно же, попыткам захватить мир! Однако, в один прекрасный день, когда он как обычно похитил принцессу Мэйэпл (явная отсылка к принцессе Пич), всегда останавливающий его до этого герой Мак просто взял... и отказался спасать принцессу. Он заявил, что Кроу не представляет реальной угрозы, эти спасения принцессы превратились в какую-то рутину, а Мэйэпл вообще чувствует себя в крепости Кроу как у себя дома и явно не испытывает особого дискомфорта по поводу своих похищений - так что Мак лучше займется чем-то полезным и разберется с настоящими преступниками, нежели будет участвовать в бессмысленном ритуале. И вот так злодей и принцесса остались без героя... Уязвленный до глубины души Кроу решает, раз уж такое дело, отправиться в другие королевства: похитить тамошних принцесс и одолеть тамошних героев.

Вот такая вот завязка. Гемплейно игра представляет из себя большей частью достаточно стандартную аркаду-платформер, сложную, но в умеренной степени. Однако, все же, есть некоторые необычные элементы, в основном вращающиеся вокруг двух моментов: а) того, что мы играем за злодея, а значит почти все битвы с боссом будут проходить в классической расстановке... только вот в роли босса будем выступать мы (то есть, на сей раз, это мы будем пилотировать гигантского робота или лазер смерти, в то время как противник будет пытаться разломать наш агрегат), а также б) Кроу все-таки путешествует между королевствами, а для здешнего мира это равносильно перескакиванию в чужие игры, из-за чего порой возникают вставки иных жанров, непривычных для нашего главзлодея (к примеру, с азиатской партией героев придется разбираться в пошаговой баталии a-la Final Fantasy). В целом, на самом деле, во время прохождения у меня не возникало ощущения однообразия игрового процесса - игра не то, чтобы постоянно переворачивала геймплей с ног на голову, но все же делала это достаточно часто. Причем, как уже можно было заметить по примерам выше, это зачастую обосновывалось сюжетно - ну или персонажи просто не упускали возможности подметить игровые моменты, кажущиеся им занимательными. Как такового пробивания четвертой стены в Nefarious, в общем-то, нет, однако сам Кроу, его приспешники, другие злодеи, похищаемые принцессы и защищающие их герои - почти все они всячески применяют свою, так сказать, жанровую подкованность, демонстрируя обширные знания канонов и штампов. И, в отличие от некоторых представителей подобных пародий, здесь это, так сказать, подсвечивание не надоедает. Здесь вообще мало что успевает надоесть, еще раз подмечу.

И все же большая часть обаяния сего творения держится на персонажах и сюжете - который, повторюсь, порой весьма тесно переплетен с игровым процессом, но это не единственное его достоинство. Конечно, идея рассказать историю от лица злодея не нова. Ну а тему "что будет со злодеем, если останавливающий его герой самоустранится" мы уже наблюдали, к примеру, в том же "Мегамозге" - но вот тут, кстати, эта мысль развита несколько иначе и с иными акцентами. Кроу, конечно, обожает разглагольствовать о том, какой он злобный злодей, читать пафосные речи о захвате мира, а также сеять хаос и разрушение... но, в то же время, он может быть весьма дружелюбен, миньоны и роботы обожают его за хорошее с ними обращение, а принцессы в большинстве своем воспринимают свои похищения как мелкое неудобство (а иногда - и как удачное стечение обстоятельств). В случае с Мэйэпл их динамика вообще полна отсылок к взаимоотношениям Пич и Баузера - с игрой в теннис, совместными походами в картинг и фактически положением Кроу, как "друга семьи", который периодически похищает принцессу по долгу злодейской роли. Вот только загвоздка в том, что Кроу никогда раньше не был так близок к фактической победе - ведь герой по канонам жанра всегда останавливает злодея... И вот теперь, когда статус кво полетело к чертям, у Кроу может появиться причина всерьез задуматься - а насколько далеко он реально хочет зайти, учитывая, что завоевать мир может быть не так уж и невозможно? Во множестве историй есть злодеи, которые никогда не добиваются успеха, динамика их взаимоотношений с героями начинает напоминать дружескую, а противостояние становится скорее забавным, нежели угрожающим. Таким персонажам аудитория нередко начинает сопереживать, и даже болеть за них... Вот только все же они остаются злодеями, и, когда у них появляется реальный шанс на победу, они начинают казаться далеко не такими забавными. Поначалу это может не бросаться в глаза, но, с развитием сюжета, это становится одной из основных тем Nefarious.

Как можно понять из вышесказанного, здесь есть некоторая доля драмы, моменты со сменой настроя на более серьезный и попросту случаи, когда сердце кровью обливается, но, все же, в первую очередь перед нами задорная комедийная пародия. Кроу откровенно наслаждается своими стереотипно-злодейскими выходками, да и остальные персонажи не отстают, обычно воспринимая все как веселое приключение. В истории предостаточно ярких действующих лиц и забавных ситуаций, в которые они попадают - шутки, в целом, достаточно хороши и порой весьма остроумны, атмосфера завлекает и наблюдать за этим сборищем злодеев, принцесс и героев откровенно весело.

Еще у этой игры совершенно шикарный саундтрек. Он, надо заметить, достаточно разнообразен - злодею предстоит посетить весьма различные по своей стилистике королевства, плюс, как я уже подмечал, игра порой довольно резко меняет свой настрой... В большинстве случаев, музыка весьма приятная, уместная и задающая настроение, к тому же мелодия порой может сама по себе быть отсылкой к жанровой классике. Единственное, следует подметить, что некоторые отдельные композиции хоть и хороши, но ужасно приставучи. После визита в псевдояпонское королевство Сукочи вы, вероятно, еще долго не сможете выкинуть из головы это "Амефутте... амефутте... чикатамаааарууууу!".

Переходя к недостаткам, самым основным в этой игре я бы назвал управление. В общем-то, сейчас уже всем прекрасно известно, что в хорошем платформере сложность должна создаваться за счет дизайна уровней и врагов, а не за счет того, что игрок не может толком контролировать своего персонажа. Последнее считается чем-то вроде моветона и создает ощущение издевательства над игроком, а не попытки создать некий челлендж. В данном конкретном случае управление... скажем так, не то, чтобы совсем ужасное, но далеко не идеальное. Грацией наш злодей явно не отличается, в то время как от нас зачастую требуется именно удивительно точное исполнение очередного прыжка. Справедливости ради, обычно вся хитровывернутая акробатика нужна для достижения особо вкусной добычи, запрятанной в каком-нибудь дальнем уголке, в то время как для прохождения самого уровня таких ухищрения, как правило, не требуется. И все же, некоторое ощущение несправедливости во время борьбы со здешним управление наблюдается. Помимо же управления... Ну, визуальный стиль Nefarious у кого-то может вызвать восторг, а кому-то совсем не понравиться - такие вещи обычно воспринимаются предельно субъективно. Собственно, пожалуй, к той же расхваливаемой мною музыке это также относится. Игра, в добавок ко всему, не очень продолжительна, но я бы не стал относить это к явным недостаткам, поскольку, как подмечалось выше, здесь, в целом, нет ощущения скудности контента. Хотя некоторые маячащие на горизонте темы все же не раскрыли так, как могли бы.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004438421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1497303830}
review: Nefarious has some decent writing and entertaining character interactions, but that can't save it from awful gameplay and often poor presentation. Loading sequences and scene transitions are abrupt and choppy. The reverse boss fights are the highlights, but everything else is a chore, especially as your basic punch attack will randomly fail to work properly 1/10 times, instead just starting the animation but not actually punching. The voice acting is good, but there are only some ten lines of it in the whole game. Crow's theme and the orc kingdom BGM are great, but the rest of the music ranges from bland to annoying. The character portraits are great,  but the sprites are ugly as sin. I finished the game and got the bad ending, but I have no motivation to play any more of it to try and see what the other endings offer. Definitely not worth the asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994913440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1499339980}
review: A nifty little action platformer game. The writting was pretty funny with how it makes fun of video game tropes/cliches and the main character "Crow' is more of the cartoonish villain type so he's a little more likeable because of that in how he takes so much joy in being a bad guy. The game is pretty short, I beat it in about 4 hours or so but getting all the collectbles will extend the length a little bit. Still, I would say it's totally worth the price point. Short but sweet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001437365', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1496968947}
review:
Nefarious has an interesting concept, ok music, and nice writing. What Nefarious lacks is good gameplay.

The controls aren't tight. Getting hit mid-jump completely stops your momentum, which would be ok except it feels like the developers just slapped enemies wherever they felt like. This is especially apparent in the later levels, where the idea of difficulty seems to be adding a lot more enemies.

Getting through an area in Nefarious feels a lot more like luck than skill. It's a shame, because this could have been a really neat game. Instead, it's a frustrating mess. I'm glad the game is short, because I don't think I could have kept going for much longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005539606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 297, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1497122524}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031943208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1497153563}
review:
I got Nefarious and (almost) finished it on the same day. It has great characters and a story that you can't help but get invested into. That being said there is one huge issue with this game:

THE CONTROLS ARE NO WHERE NEAR TIGHT AND RESPONSIVE ENOUGH
You are very slidy as a character and your close range attacks are a joke. If you are like me you will basically go through the whole level using your projectiles as you cannot get in close without running into the enemies. Most of the levels I can go through no problem. However, there are several moments in the game where i bang my head in frustration as I fall in pitholes or die from enemy attacks I simply was not able to avoid due to the slidy controls. It is like playing an ice level in mario. So why i am not waiting until after i beat the final boss to write the review? because the final boss is one of the most frustrating moments because it relies on precision attacks while avoiding a lazer, something the controls are not capable of doing. 

The game would get a strong review from me if were not for this, the levels are well made and very unique, but they are designed for tight controls, which makes completing them extreamily frustrating. 

So why do I still recomend the game? 

Mainly because I am a sucker for good story and characters. If you want a good story and experience and are willing to forgive the not so stellar controls, then this game is for you. If you don't care about the story and just want a solid platformer, then I would suggest to stay far away from this game.



EDIT: Wow, i never thought a single boss fight could change my whole review. However, the final boss unfortunatley has forced me to change my review to a negative one. I will try to not spoil it, it is a multi stage boss fight that requires precision attacks and you must do so all on the same life with no checkpoints. A game with tight controls can pull this off, no problem.....This game does not have tight controls. It is possible to beat it and many will boast they have one it in two to three tries. that being said, it is probably in my opinion one of the worst designed bosses in the game and really highlights the lack of understanding the designers had toward their game's controls. I have used a controller for the game and it feels awful. I really want to love it, I really do, but either the controls need to be tightened up or the final boss needs to be tweaked to make up for the slippery controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076187273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1497474854}
review:
Buy this game when on sale.

I got it by accident when I forgot to cancel my subscription to Indiebox and while I am having a lot of fun with it, it is also an incredibly unfinished game with awful menus and some awkward animation and sound glitches.

Pros:
-The art of the character portrait and some of the ones in game are great.
-The concept of reverse bosses is so cool.
-The characters are very charming and fun to meet. From Crow to the princesses.
-It has a pretty decent duration. I took me 6 hours to beat it with both endings without all the collectibles. It's not great but it's more than I can say for a lot of indies.
-The music is pretty neat.
-The gameplay is surprisingly fun, sometimes original too.

Cons:
-The game is painfully amateurish in its transitions and some of the storytelling.
-Some of the art looks like golden-age-newgrounds stuff. Sometimes the in-game art is not very representative of the character portraits.
-The animations are pretty cringey sometimes.
-The collisions sometimes screw up.
-The sounds are clearly stock royalty-free sounds, some of them don't match the rest of the game and it just sounds weird. 
-The audio sometimes screws up but I would blame that on Unity.

Conclusion: It's an alright game. Pretty fun at times and the characters and writing is pretty damn good. It's a shame most of the time the art is so bad and there are so many unpolished details with how it looks and feels. 
Give it a try once it's on discount. I am glad I got it but not about getting the indiebox for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086978946', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1496873472}
review:
Nefarious gives me mixed feelings. While an enjoyable single player experience, it felt hollow at times to me.

*BEFORE I go any further, note this review will have spoilers. I want to dissect this game and why its problems stand out to me in full. So because of this, I wont have censor bars. If only because that would get annoying to see almost half or all of the review blanketed. Thank you.*

    First off, the music. Its not bad, but at times during a level, the music really didn't fit the mood of the situation. It feels awkward to me and the music can potentially get annoying hearing it on repeat. Some change in music would be nice sometimes.

    Gameplay is weird, and it is a MUST, I REPEAT MUST to have a controller, or you'll have trouble with this game. Its movement feels a bit sticky and slippery at the same time, as your character slides with what little momenteum he's got. This makes it troubling when in later levels you have to deal with instant death pits and surfaces. It is ESPECIALLY frustrating on the secret level, when you have to hop on small moving platforms to get to the next checkpoint. I just got frustrated at this game really. The punching is awkward as it sometimes, if not, always misses the enemies or doesn't push them back enough to not get hit. Making the ranged weapon a must use. And lobbing grinades is annoying enough as it is as you have no way of telling what the tragectory is unless you spam it, which is equally risky as your bombs can knock you around.
    Topping this with platforming and enemies that can fill the screen and/or attack through surfaces like walls, then you have frustrating gameplay. And this doesn't help when the true final boss is a little more fast paced than previous fights. And this current state of the gameplay isn't equipped for that if you top THAT with bad hit detection, which is very, very frequent. Weapons that should miss you by inches hit you anyways, and being on the hearts system, thats not a good recipe. I really dont like this gameplay on later levels as it really does break my interest in the game when I have to be focused on the dumbest things. Especially on bramble path, which, by the way, has the most infuriating platforming in a game with slippery/sticky controls while enemies flood you at every orface. This is not fun, this is annoying. A bunch of badly made mechanics are clumped together to create an annoying game that is realized later down the line.

    The one thing that kept me going, although, was the story and humor. The humor is gigglingly funny if only because the story lines up well with it. Being about a villian trying to break the status quo of "Hero beats baddy, wins the day". I like it then, but then the story goes into "friendship solves all problems", which was kind of a let down, but the humor was enough to make me ignore some of the stories downfalls. If you like funny and witty dialogue, come down here.

    The artstyle, let me be honest, is not that great. Its trying to go for a cartoony look but it just doesn't fit. I feel it should've had more flare to it or at least some interesting theme around it, but its just plain cartoony. In all honesty, I dont like it. It doesn't have to be pixelly or anything, but I would prefer it would be more interesting to look at if anything.  Mixing that with the music and it honestly feels bland after the seventh loop of the same song. Not that great in my personal opinion.

    The "Reverse-Boss Fights" are...really meh when you think about it. Really its just pressing some buttons, while doing one thing that dodges their attack. It could've been more dynamic or challenging, but it just didn't feel like so. The final boss on the normal route though, that was honestly good to play, if only because the challenge felt like it was there. The true final boss fight, again, was near impossible unless you had a stroke of luck. It practically requires a controller to play and even then good luck with the hit detection/hit boxes.


    Overall, not that great. It may have good humor and an interesting story, but its just held down from being what it is, a video game. Unless its on a damn good sale or you just want to see what its like for yourself, go ahead. Just be warned as the repetitive unchanging music mixed with a featureless artstyle, frustrating gameplay and somewhat disappointing outcome of the story can make for a boring experience that might as well have been time spent on something else.

I love this game for what it set out, but the outcome just didn't meet basic standards.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979808585', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1497075448}
review: I love this game to death. The gameplay. The soundtrack. The characters. The weapons and upgrades. This game took me for an emotional roller coaster, and the ending was an extremely excellent finale to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049404772', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1564930051}
review:
Before this game, I don't remember the last time I actually had *fun* playing some game. Like, not worrying about game objectives, not stressing about the tasks I need to carry out, and instead enjoy rummaging through the level. Then I played Nefarious, and I had it. I loved it. The dialogues were funny, the characters are cool and fleshed out (I had my favourite in like 10 minutes into the game), and the game wasn't "repetitive" - doing the levels didn't feel a chore. And the reverse boss-fights were awesome!

If you want to play a superhero-game, where you are the villain, and want the classic 2D-platformer feeling, you'll have it!

(I didn't speak about the soundtrack. I liked it, but I never paid much attention to music in games, so I can't really formulate a well-versed opinion.)

review:
There are few games that hit you right in the childhood. This game does it flawlessly. Going through the boss fights brought me back to when I was sitting in front of my tv, fighting the bad guy and saving the princess. Great characters, great level design, and a fantastic soundtrack. 10 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027748338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1491880835}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007239254', 'num_games_owned': 4907, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 3788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3788, 'last_played': 1486428588}
review:
Nefarious sees you take on the role of Crow the villain in a 2D platformer with essentially Megaman as your main arch rival.

While the whole game is nothing amazingly new there are some pretty cool things in here which make Nefarious a definite highlight in an already jam packed 2017.

The basic levels are pretty standard platform run and gunning type games. There is a pretty cool mechanic that halfway through each level you manage ti kidnap the princess you are hunting (for your princess powered doomsday device) and she alters the controls and gives you a brand new ability that alters the rest of the level.
I am surprised that you could not the go on to replay levels with the other princesses powers to access new areas but perhaps that was what the Metroidvania game this really should have been could have done to stand out from the crowd.

A real highlight fo the game, however, is the boss fights where instead of playing the sprightly hero you play the big hulking boss complete with big death rays and easily telegraphable attacks. Most of these fights are excellent and it really is something that makes the game stand out.
Visually the game is very pretty and some of the more artistic sections (particularly and underwater level) are damn right gorgeous to loo at.

The storyline is also very interesting and I was desperate to see where it was going to end up. I must say however the standard ending was very disappointing and I was left desperate to see the true ending which sadly didn’t massively improve the outcome.

The general gameplay is a mixed bag but mostly enjoyable and I really did have a great time with Nefarious in my 4hourish playthrough.

Nefarious is not perfect by any means but it is a very enjoyable game that I would definitely recommend if you are looking for a fun action platformer with a decent twist.

For our full review check out our video review here: http://www.thegametutor.co.uk/videos/game-tutor-grades/170224_game-tutor-grades-nefarius

author: {'steamid': '76561197983286479', 'num_games_owned': 1231, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1490915886}
review:
This is a bad platformer. It has nice visuals and ok music, but that's it. As much atractive as the idea of being the villain in a classic sidescroller is, this plays just the same as any other 90% of the time. The boss fights were you control the big mean machine are the only parts where the concept really comes into play, but even then it's a bad game because of one reason:

Awful design. Everything feels clunky and floaty, everything feels physics based. Enemies are positioned at random around empty boring levels with just platforms and coins placed wherever. Nothing in the gameplay is satisfying, everything here screams amateur game design, it just looks nice. Sound effects, hit boxes, collision... everything is a mess. I really can't recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040546716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1490543574}
review:
A fun platformer that can be challenging at times, but that's not a bad thing. It's cleverly written and plays around with the typical villain tropes.
The character designs are also nice and fun too.

It may be on the short side, but platformers usually aren't longer than 10 hours. You can probably beat it in six hours. And I'm including all the side missions here. Though don't let the leanght of the game frighten you because it's an indie game which costs 14,99€, not an AAA game that costs 60€. XD

Overall so do I think it is a good game and I'm glad that I backed it on Kickstarter. :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198035344965', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1495744304}
review:
The story is a lot better then what I expected from this game. I just figured it was going to be goofy, but just like was the case for me with Disgaea, it does have it's more serious moments and even might hit you in the feels a time or two.

The gameplay really isn't anything special but it serves it's purpose and I enjoyed it well enough as someone who usually doesn't like playing platformers.

Also has one of the most memorable soundtracks for me in recent memory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181693865', 'num_games_owned': 10, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1567114914}
review:
I have paid actual money for this game, and it was a blast! Throwing grenades left and right, punching the heroes in the face, and snatching up the princesses like candy during halloween! There is great character developement, the controls are a-ok, and the (reverse)bosses are neat! A great reverse roll platformer! Wanna be a bad guy? BE THE BAD GUY! BE CROW, THE MOST NEFARIOUS, EVILEST, BADDEST GUY WITH A MECHANICAL RIGHT HAND! Also, the fanbase is getting bigger and bigger from what I've seen, why not join it?
Now then, with every positive, there is a negative.. Some of the levels become a spammy bullet hell, and some levels are nearly impossible if you haven't been practicing. I died a total of 80 times in this short game, did I mention this game is too short? If there was a sequel, I would gladly give it a 10/10. But nope, no sequel yet. Thankfully, there is a comic that expands on the Nefarious universe. So i'm giving this a 9.99/10. Now then, ARE YOU A REAL VILLIAN? WANNA BE NUMBER 1? GIT DIS GAME!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997634454', 'num_games_owned': 797, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 7110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7067, 'last_played': 1543203294}
review:
Ever wanted to play as the villain? Nefarious is an excellent 2D platformer with plenty of throwbacks to classic games from the SNES/MegaDrive era in which you play the lead villain.

[h1]Cons[/h1]
It's a bit short, around 6 hours for your first playthrough and 10 hours if you push for 100%

[h1]Pros[/h1]
Excellent character design and development
Brilliant music (Bonus Round for ten hours needs to be a thing)
Multiple endings!
Reverse boss fights! (YOU control the giant mecha and defeat the hero!)
Fantastically solid gameplay mechanics. I cannot overstate how good the grenades are!

[h1]In Summary[/h1]
Nefarious is a bit short but overall it's a fantastic little game that has unfortunately gone under the radar for most people. I've purposely avoided mentioning the story in this review but the main character sums it up best in the intro:
"Tell me if you've heard this one before....Bad guy crashes party. Kidnaps princess! Makes dramatic exit. But, funny story....Yea, I'm the bad guy!"

[h1]-Edit-[/h1]
So after playing for well over 100 hours (Steam has not been able to track all the hours for various reasons) I can honestly say I know this game better than most, and the controls are precise (yet forgiving), boss fights can be a bit on the easy side, music is fantastic,level design works flawlessly with the controls, the characters really draw you in to a brilliant story and there are almost no bugs (believe me, I'd be happy for some!). Really the only downside to this game is that it's short. Easily GOTY 2017 for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058893541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1489857005}
review: If it wasn't for the setting this would be an utterly average platformer. The art style is pretty solid, the music is functional and while the reverse boss fights are thematic and mechanically intersting the platforming mechanics outside if them are about as uninspired as it gets. The story is nice if a bit typical in its "twists". If there was a "meh" option instead of just yay/nay I'd tick it but as is...

author: {'steamid': '76561197995212192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1489337216}
review:
Nice little platformer, enjoyed being the boss in the boss fight!
Not very long but well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028653158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1489300695}
review:
The writing in thisgame is Phenominal. Crow is everything you'd expect from a no holds barred, joyful in his eviler-than-evil villian ofhis caliber. Easily the best executed villian game since Evil Genius.

Gameplay is surprisingly varied and delivers on the promise of reverse boss fights. The story was surprisingly impactful and had me attached to all the characters and their situations. And it snuck all those feelings in under some of the most hilarious dialogue and savage roasting of the characters and hero/villian tropes you could imagine.

I kickstated this game way back when and was not dissapointed. Would deffinately recomend this game to pretty much anyone. Great story, varied gameplay, phenominal characters, just an all  round great experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067449493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1489036322}
review:
Now, let me explain. This game is fairly short, but the time I had playing it, it was great. The premise of you being the bad guy was extremely well done. It truly feels like you ARE the bad guy. The plot is sweet, the gameplay is great----I could go on about this game for hours. So, let me just give you the fast version.

[b]PROS:[/b]
- Amazing story, amazing characters
- Fun, and interesting gameplay.
- Good and bad endings
- Some replayability
- Solid soundtrack
- Switches up the gameplay a lot; the first level you'll be doing something different than the next.
- Light-hearted and funny dialogue, and can kick you in the gut with feels.

[b]CONS:[/b]
- Some replayability.
- The difficulty curve is a bit strange. I'd be breezing through an easy level, then get demolished with the next level.
- The upgrading system's UI is unclear. I thought I was to unlock the locked upgrades as I went.

As I played through, I enjoyed this game thoroughly. It's a lot of fun, both in story and out. I give this game an 7/10. Get it as soon as you have enough steam money if you're at all interested.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987312565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1489000682}
review:
A nicely subversive, well-written game with plenty of interesting characters and references to the classics. Really the story, setup, characters and dialogue are the main attraction here.

Gameplay itself is a solid platformer, without anything too fancy; though there are several stages and boss battles with different mechanics that keeps things fresh. Bonus points for the game playing quite well on a keyboard and mouse setup, and not requiring a controller.

The character art is also cute and fitting; the only complaint would probably be against the actual in-game sprites, which do feel slightly amateurish, and at times not fitting the character or the contents of dialogue. Animation quality is just fine, however.

Overall very much recommended, even if you're not a huge fan of platformers; I'm not and I had a lot of fun with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991346561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1489521291}
review:
I really wanted to like this game, it's a fun concept, the writing is silly, the ideas in it are great, but the level and mechanics design are frankly uninspired. The most fun I had, really, was on the first level of the game. The boss battles are either super easy, or rediculously hard, because they don't explain the mechanics or the controls are so precise and you have no change to practice with them.

I want to like the game, I do, and I don't plan on returning it, but for a game about being ABOUT the boss fight? It's boss fights are incredibly unsatisfying. Why not make a game about us going around IN OUR BOSS THING to kidnap the princesses? Instead of megamanning about first?

author: {'steamid': '76561198206112688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1573924471}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066934000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1487919011}
review:
Pros:
Good Story and Characters
Funny and Enjoyable Dialogue
Boss Battles as the Boss are almost always fun
((This is subjective but)) Gashi-Gashi's art for the character portraits is spot-on

Cons:
Mechanics and Controls are not as precise as they need to be for some of the ridiculous platforming the game wants you to do
The shifts in art quality between the portraits and the in-game models is distracting
There aren't enough of the unique Boss Battles as the Boss
Grenade Jumps: Cool in concept, difficult in execution

In short, you'll want to play through the game to find how to get the good ending but you will be tested in actually playing the game itself at times, especially with Grenade Jumps. Those damn Grenade Jumps . . .
I say buy it but be ready to die at times to some frankly utter bullshit. You'll get past it eventually but you'll be ticked about it afterwards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002484742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1486421967}
review: Nefarious, left me with alot of feelings, many of which were wonderful. It made me feel sort of inspired. author: {'steamid': '76561197996598947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1489862353}
review:
To start things off this game isn't that bad.  It has potential but it also has it's own share of problems.

Let's start with the positives,  One of the games biggest strengths is it's character interactions.  The game does have a lot of charm to it and I do like a lot of the characters that we do meet.  The artwork is alright with the character portraits being some of the best looking bits.  The music isn't too bad and I found myself wondering which track is my favorite because as soon as I thought I had one favorite track the next level would suprise me with an even better track.  It has a decent amount of stages with secret ones that show up once certain criteria are met.

However there are a few flaws that I would like to talk about.  
One of the biggest ones has to do with the music.  As nice as the songs are, they have a problem with not being able to loop seamlessly like you would see in practically every other game.  The songs have clear endpoints and start points so it's obvious when the track restarts.  Heck some of them even leave you with a few seconds of nothing before the music starts up again and it can be annoying especially on the longer stages.  Again the music isn't bad but I just wish they actually looped correctly.

The next point of contention has to be the boss battles.  They are somewhat varied as in the stages that do contain them have different fights so that the fight in one stage is not the same one you get in another.  One example would be the snow stage boss involves you in a giant robot while the lava stage boss fight is a turn based rpg battle.  However this variety comes at a cost.  No boss fight feels really complete.  They are all barebones and simplistic.  This would have been a great chance to get creative but it seems to be a wasted opportunity.  An example of this would be the snow stage.  It basically consists of you inside a giant robot with the only thing to attack with is your robo fists, by smashing them down on the hero running across the bottom of the screen.  You can see everything about the fight within the first several seconds becasue that's all the fight is.

However the biggest problem lies within the sovereign.  If you happen to leave the game and come back, you will be in your ship however all the princesses that have been kidnapped so far will have disappeared.  This will lead to a problem in three seperate occasions.  The first being that there is a part of the game where you need to talk to them for a quest and since they won't be there because you quite the game, you essentially become stuck until restart the stage because restarting the game won't fix your problem.  The other two times so far will cause you to miss cutscenes that happen when you try to select a level.  One of the cutscenes that can be missed will in fact lock you out of a secret level because the cutscene is needed to initiate the stage that unlocks the hidden stage.  It's a problem that I don't know how the developer missed it  through testing.

All said I would recommend the game because despite it's flaws it really isn't that bad.  It just needs more polish and for the boss fights to be fleshed out better and not be so barebones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089995333', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1688426047}

author: {'steamid': '76561198123059413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1500559962}
review:
I had a blast playing this, and the story was every bit as entertaining as I hoped. The dialogue was indeed worthy of being called witty banter, and the constant lampshading made everything better.

...also I did not expect something that started with such a silly feel at the beginning to suckerpunch me in the emotions that hard as the game went on. Like...DAMN, wow.

About the only complaint might be the sheer ridiculous difficulty of the final boss battle for the Good End, but that may also be due to me being awful at twin sticks.

Great stuff, definitely worth a play!

...and maybe someday I'll get the good end. SOMEDAYYYYYYYYYY

author: {'steamid': '76561198044198861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1487054783}
review:
I really wanted to love this game.

The concept of pitting the player as a boss type villain in a platformer is original, the world is colorful thanks to the artistic talent of Gashi-Gashi, the music is serviceable with a few catchy tunes you'll no doubt be humming to and the writing is charming due to the quirkiness of the many characters present in Nefarious. However, the one component that is holding the game far back is the gameplay itself. There's a great game underneath waiting to be released from the chains of its frustrating sluggish controls, the slippery platforming, the odd lacking of sound effects in game and the questionable placement of enemies in the game. The "Boss" Sections of the game while no doubt harking back to that of classic bosses felt underwhelming in execution with said sluggish controls and lack of sound effects bringing down the feel of being this destructive "final boss" and ruining the satisfication one would normally experience in other games as the hero beating said boss. 

This by no means is a horrible game but rather a game with unrealized potiential, a game that very much needs more polishing to fully realize its concept as being this platformer supervillain boss in a quirky colorful world. I would buy this game again in a heartbeat if these issues were addressed but for now it is not worth the $14.99 price tag.

EDIT: Looking back more closely, yeah Gashi-Gashi had only did the character potraits and the promotional art of the game. Not the sprites and background of the game at all, a bit disappointing but ah well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271717873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1486945854}
review: Great game, really good nostalgic feel. It is pretty short, about 3-4 hours for me to play through doing a few levels over looking for collectibles, but had fun the whole time. Made me laugh out loud a few times, it has a solid sense of humor and good writting, and I really enjoyed the music too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198137747666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1486948924}
review:
Kidnap Princesses! Defeat Heroes! Be the Villian! And embrace all the tropes that come with it!

Nefarious could have been seen as another clever, fun platformer, there are a lot, but it really sets itself apart from the pack. The humor and riffing on the classic hero vs villian mentality makes even the truly evil Crow a joy to watch as he wrecks havoc, princess in tow. Most times having a princess with you will also add a new element to the platforming, like a high jump, or creating bridges with smoke. Then, after all the mooks and common do-gooders have been defeated, take part in what they call a reverse boss fight. Be the boss smacking the hero around! Get your giant robot and shoot lasers at a nimble hero, trying to take you down! These fights are fun, if only a small part of the whole, but thematically they're awesome and all the fun outweighs the feeling of it just being a different kind of boss fight.

It's not without faults, the grenades seem to sort of just... go where they will, and physics can be a bit wonky at times. I also thought we were past insta-kill traps but here we remain.

Also, the music is great, I think the animation is fantastic, and it's a lot of fun, that's all very subjective though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044010520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1557691104}
review:
"Are you ar real vilain? Have you ever caugh a good guy, like a superhero? Have you ever tried to disguise? Alright, I can see that I'll have to teach you how to be vilains"

Memes aside, Nefarious is a indie 2D platformer that was funded via kickstarter where you plays as Crow, the boss of a vilainous group, who kidnapp princess for a living and try to take over the world. The game is fully aware of the different tropes of the genre and fully play with it. Since you play as the bad guy, expect boss fight where YOU are in the giant mech.
While the game is good, it's far from perfection.

Graphically speaking, it's not very great. The differents backgrouds are nice and everything is well animated, but the rest is kinda meh (think of flash games you can find on newgrounds)

Gameplay wise, it's solid. Movement key, jump, punch, shoot and interact. Most level ask you to go and capture a princess, leave while using some power given by her then fight a good guy to end the level. Each boss fight is different and no level feel the same.  With the money you get during levels, you can upgrade Crow by expanding his life and grenade count or change how his punch and grenades works. The game is rather easy since there is a lots of checkpoints and death is only a nuisance (you lose some money, you can get it back if you go where you died).

The game isn't that long but each level has 3 crown to collect and a vinyl (used to listen to the OST between levels), each level taking from 5 min to 15. There is 2 endings and a bunch of difficult achievement.
Speaking of OST, some are great, some are meh, the only big downside is that the music doesn't loop properly, leaving a blank of 2-3 second before playing the intro again.

The story isn't that deep (which is expected for the genre but still with some surprising twist) but some of the characters are well written (saddly, most of them are meh or haven't enough interaction to have any real personnality).

The game cost 15€ but I'd recommand to wait 'till it's on sale before buying it. The dev' promised some bonus content in the futur even if they haven't met any stretch goals.


Nefarious might not be vilain numer one, but it's still a good game overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994011916', 'num_games_owned': 1286, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1485312144}
review:
Here's the thing about Nefarious: Great ideas for making you feel like the villain, especially in the boss fights, but this game displays a REMARKABLE lack of polish.

For example, the first boss fight sees you piloting a small spherical ship carrying a wrecking ball on a chain that you swing around to hit the attacking hero, which is essentially the first boss fight from Sonic the Hedgehog but with you as Eggman/Robotnik. Great idea, right?

The hero raises these towers from the ground that he'll stand on to shoot at you, and you can use the ball to knock them down. But when you knock them down, they just fall over. There's no particle effects, no screen shaking, there aren't even any [i]sound effects[/i] to go along with it. And when you hit the hero with the ball, it just plays a small "whack" sound effect and [i]the ball[/i] bounces off of [i]him[/i]. You'd expect that he'd get flung across the stage from the force of being hit, but no. He's not affected by being struck by the ball in the slightest, except that it makes him a little dizzy. The ball, however, bounces right off his head as if he's made of concrete. This makes it feel like the ball actually weighs [i]less[/i] than the hero does, and more like you're swinging around an oversized party balloon instead of a massive wrecking ball of solid metal.

This kinda stuff doesn't make the game BAD, but it really gives the whole experience a very ho-hum feeling because nothing you do seems to have any real impact. Any POWER! You're finally given access to all the rad weapons that every villain you've ever had to fight has used against you, and they just seem hollow and lackluster. Combine this with the fact that there's ZERO dialogue after beating any of the heroes (in stark contrast to practically every other interaction with them), and the end result is that these super cool and cleverly designed encounters just come across as unimpressive and gimmicky. Which is a real shame, because the actual gameplay is pretty fun and interesting, and you can tell that a lot of effort went into making them challenging while being faithful to the original boss fights they were inspired by AND also fun at the same time.

I [i]sincerely[/i] hope that this is something StarBlade can address by pushing out some updates to the game or something, because it wouldn't take a whole lot of work compared to what they've already done, and I have a feeling that it'd really improve the game's overall reception. They have a solid design, great characters, and snappy voice acting to flesh out geniunely comedic writing, but they really need to make it seem like Crow is the badass evil mastermind that he deserves to be.

With a small amount of extra attention, Nefarious could really be something special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198235154516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1486684429}
