author: {'steamid': '76561197996231119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1485487709}
review:
This game is everything I want in a game.

The writing is fantastic. Every line is pure gold, the jokes are great, and the plot keeps me guessing.

All the characters are unique and interesting. For a game with such a stereotypical concept (kidnap princesses) it really know how to play off those tropes in interseting and creative ways.

The gameplay is arguably the weakest category. It's a side-scroller platformer with shooting and punching. But even that has a pretty balanced sense of difficulty. You're bound to die a few times unless you're the hardest of the core and there's some intense challenges if you collect everything, but it you just want to see the story, it never reaches "insurmountable" unless you don't know how your weapons work. 

The music is fantastic. It's not quite Undertale level, but some of those songs come close, pumping you up for action, winding you down for a moodier moment, and always, always, creating those earworm melodies that you find yourself singing along.

I've been having a bit of a bad week so far but this game made me smile and laugh and forget my worries for just a while. And when I found out my brother was having a bad day as well, I told him to try it and it cheered him up too. Play this if you need to smile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072660140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1501643130}
review:
I backed this game a long time ago and have been anxious for its release for a long time. I've gotten all endings now and it's won me over enough to give a recommendation. However, this is by no means a perfect game. While the writing and art are stellar, the sound design is poor, what with songs that don't loop correctly, a lack of a variety of boss songs, certain moves and attacks that don't have sound effects that feel that they should. 

As far as the gameplay is concerned, I honestly wish this game had controller support as it's much harder to platform with WASD and shoot with a mouse than, say, use two analog sticks. With level design and enemy placement that creates nearly unavoidable damage at certain points, the gameplay itself is not a high point at all. Not to mention how frustrating it can be to grenade jump properly at certain points or how I experienced glitches, one of which sent me falling out of world when I stood between two police cars.

Yet, I still recommend this game because it has charm and fun writing that engaged me enough to make me want to keep playing. As somebody in love with the game's concept, I found this game to be fun overall. 

But if the concept doesn't immediately pull you in, you may find this game boring or frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996785232', 'num_games_owned': 1122, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1485271577}
review: It was weird playing a game that actually let me have fun for a change, and didn't make me wade through hours of repitive combat to get that rewarding feeling. I really felt attached to the characters, I want more of them :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198000852812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1485398299}
review:
"Charming" is the best way to describe Nefarious. A charming little platformer, maybe 3-5 hours in length, and made with so much love it's practically bursting at the seams with affection.

It's a capital "I" Indie game, so there are some minor UI bugs, and an occasional glitch that makes NPCs disappear and requires a reload to fix, but if you go in expecting some rough corners, Nefarious has the heart to make it worth your time.

Just don't get the Machine Gun Fist, it's a trap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023604943', 'num_games_owned': 1667, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1485426087}
review:
Do not get my non-recommendation wrong, this game is excellent in its theming, and framing. The story is nice. the gameplay is good. I wanted to love this game, I really wanted to love every moment of it. It holds a ton of nostalgia for games like Megaman, and Megaman X. Which is a big plus for me.

But, I never knew it was possible, until this game, that it was even possible for me to get so irritated by the small things, that I had to abandon the game. It makes me sad. This game had so much potential, and I'm really sad I had to let it go. The audio mastering was terrible, both in the general sound effects department, and in the BGM department. the BGM had its own character, and flavor, and was unique, but didn't jive with the gameplay. Fun, action-oriented levels with passive, underwhelming music in the background, I felt like all of the music being used in the main levels should have been used in instances of dialogue, instead. It's like combining an eye-opener of a game, with music you could fall asleep to.

The music was the least of my worries, however, as the sound effects for the game just sounded cheap, REALLY cheap. Which,  when combined with the aforementioned music choices, it made for a really empty experience. It's so bizarre, that an otherwise good gaming experience, for me, was so easily dismounted, so easily undone, by the sound design alone. Any qualms I had with the game itself were minimal. I can't say any of the levels, themselves, were boring, aside from a certain level where you dive underwater to find sunken treasure.

So, that's just it. The thing that irritated me most for this game, was the fact that I didn't like it. I wanted to like it so badly, and yet, here I am, quietly requesting that the game developer step back, and remaster the audio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046706319', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1485242153}
review: listen i was hyped for this game. at first it looked great. gashi gashi doing the art. reverse bossfights princesses little tropes a villains arsenal. then i played the game. the first couple levels were alright  i guess. nothing too impressive. the humor was good. i thought it had voice acting the first few seconds. then everything became average. i didnt feel like i was having fun. the egg man reverse fight was okay the rpg one was shit. i noticed later the characters sprites(?) were not appealing to look at. i made my way through half the game looking at the portraits gashi gashi did and only then realized the actual sprites were gross. the arsenal was interesting to get into for 3 levels and then it all became boring. like this is a little upsetting i wouldn't recommend it but i won't try to hunt everyone who wants to play it down and tell them no either. who ever is reading this now it's all up to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042456689', 'num_games_owned': 2005, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1485398383}
review: Alright so after getting both endings I'd like to put a bit of my own input in about the game, and straight up it's a mixed bag.  The controls feel a bit floaty on platforming, and the controler aiming is rather  meh compared to the mouse with the flying gnats requiring you all to but buy the gun to avoid one  big headache. Next up is the mostly lack luster boss fights as some of them where bland to just entirely unfun. And the bits of altered gameplay the Princesses offer are only for long as your holding them so at most you'll get to play with them once, or twice the entire game. Not going into detail there is also one fight you'll need to replay several times to get a decent handle on it, and even then it's going to be a pain unless it's altered.  So I'd say pick it up if your into the concept but be warry that it needs some extra polish, and will only last you one good play session unless your going to 100%. So all in all I'd have to give it a 6 not bad, but lower your expectations for being a villian.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984309692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1485584159}
review:
I kickstarted this game a century ago,  and back then I thought it looked to be an exceptional game.  I then proceeded to forget that I kickstarted it and forgot about its existance till today...

I can now say I was correct with my observation then,  because it REALLY IS an exceptional game.  Top notch platforming,  unique reverse boss fights that definitely are fun in their individual contexts,  and a surprisingly excellent soundtrack.  Oh,  and a great sense of humor and story.

This game is without a shadow of a doubt worth your time,  especially if your a fan of classic old school platformers.  It can "really" scratch the itch for a classic game.  Its time to make the good guys cry like a prom fan on anime night!(Which for me is usually sunday night,  I catch up on all the new episodes that day of the week.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198012852003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1485231044}
review:
+ Concept, character building and dialogue are spot on. A real treat to enjoy
+ Variety of unique gameplay styles and encounters helps keep things fresh
+ Art from Gashi-Gashi is delightful

- Enemy placement and level designof the basic platformer gameplay are rather unfair, often unfun
- The Sound Effects (or lack thereof) in the boss battles makes them feel a little hollow

I was pretty excited to play this game when it came to my attention a couple weeks ago. I was excited to play from the other side. I always thought that the villain was always the more interesting character. For a good portion of the game though, it plays out like a lot of other typical  platformers. The way the game sets itself apart being the delightful banter between characters and the power-trip of being the bad guy. There is a variety of gameplay styles included in the game, but the majority of it your standard platformer ... a platformer that  can be rather unforgiving. This really seems in contrast with the power-trip that I wanted to get out of this game. 

So yeah, the gameplay was disappointing in parts, but I fell in love with the characters. I have little desire to actually play the game anymore, but I felt I got what I paid for. I want more of the characters, but I don't feel like it has to be from here. If there was a TV show, movie, or comic book with Crow as our lead guy I'd be all over it. That being said, if this was introduced to me some other way, it wouldn't stick. It had to be a video game for this to work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088355247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1485402463}
review:
Ok, so I'm a very huge fan of the concept of being a villain. This game? does exactly that. Sure, I beat this game in 6 hours cause this game reminds me of Wario Land, but it was a great experience to fight those goody two shoes heroes and foiling their generic themed rescue missions. This game most of it all; RPG elements (for like 10 minutes), underwater segments, references to other video games (I'm looking at you villain museum lake), and many other things. Now, There are some things about this game that is frustrating.... well in my opinion that is.
1) This game did feel rather short, but then again its probably cause I'm one of those "advanced gamers"
2) This game's collectables are rather frustrating to find or understand where to access
3) This game feels like There is some cut content which makes it feel short

Other than those peeves listed above, this game is great.
Good Soundtrack? You bet.
Good character design and level design? But Of course!
Good Story? Hell yeah! 

So what score could I possibly give this game? 
8.3 outta 10 seems fair
mostly cause of its length but it's  positives make up for its length.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286083786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1485233020}

I can't wait to see what's in store for the future of this game

author: {'steamid': '76561197996138739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1508372159}
review:
I backed Nefarious on Kickstarter some time ago and am happy to see it made it all the way to release. The world and characters Starblade has created are top notch and worth experiencing. This is an awesome franchise in its infancy, presented by a small studio, and I hope to see it flourish into a top tier production. 

I agree with previous reviews that so far the levels are basic and easy (especially the first two) but once the 3rd stage hits the complexity kicks up a little and the music really begins fitting the action. The gameplay is smooth with the exception of the reverse boss fights, but I think these fights are meant to be a bit clunky. 

The story and humor remind me of Shantae and more than make up for the polish and complexity that Nefarious lacks. I was let down by Mighty No. 9, not so for this game. I've already got my monies worth and look forward to finishing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198187443738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1482812882}
review: Wonderful game, probably one of the most refreshing thing I've played in years. Art and music are spectacular, gameplay is familiar yet new, and it offers a good level of challenge for all skill levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999496491', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1523948022}
review: Remember the Flash games you played as a kid at school? Think one of those, given a great art budget and great writing. Gave me a hell of a nostalgia trip, but not at all for the reasons I expected it to. Controls a touch clunky (WASD for movement, left/right click for attacks, like old flash games) if you aren't used to it, and I personally wasn't a huge fan of the music (Matthew Taranto's a great artist, I just don't think his jazzy style really suits the game), but the game oozes charm and is definitely a hoot for a playthrough or two.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021348961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1485470797}
review: Bought and finished this game on release, and I honestly think it's the best platformer I've played. Everything about it is so well put together and so spirited that I couldn't help but play through all of it in one sitting. I sincerely hope that this game gets the recognition it deserves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061620520', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1485317233}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079014620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 983, 'last_played': 1547696805}
review:
Nefarious is a unique concept and a great throwback to old-school platformers. I give it [b]two thoraxes up[/b] (play the game and you'll get it) and my strongest of recommendations. The game is a great pick-up for seasoned platform gamers and newbies alike with a difficulty curve very reminiscent of the old Sonic the Hedgehog games. 

[b]Pros:[/b] Incredible soundtrack [i](a particular nod to the "Heartless Abyss" level's music)[/i], great nostalgic references for seasoned platform gamers, great humor, RPG-like upgrade system, multiple endings, great replay value.

[b]Cons:[/b] Contols are a little difficult to pick up initially. Akin to Megaman games, some of the later bosses verge on too difficult for casual gamers to enjoy.

The game's levels play like a Megaman game with the ability to power Crow up as you collect money, and a fun and interesting "bomb jump" mechanic that lets you perform a non-damaging double-jump when colliding with your own projectiles in mid air. An added bonus is most princesses you kidnap embue with some of their powers while you hold them, like higher jumps or unlimited ammo. Then come the bosses...

Ever played Sonic, gotten frustrated and said "Dr. Eggman is so cheap and has it so easy in that giant machine."?
Well, this game's signature "reverse boss fights" let you see from Eggman, Bowser and the like's perspective that the grass isn't neccessarily greener on the other side. Instead of playing Hulk Smash, the fights are a challenge akin to swatting a very intellegent fly. 

There are multiple endings and enough achievements and sub-quests to sate even the thirstiest of completionists.

Make like Crow kidnapping Mayapple and pick this one up today!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972818857', 'num_games_owned': 945, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1485235465}
review:
Looks great, music is great. The combat can be a little clunky at times but it's a helll of a lot better than Might 9 was trying to be. 
It's a simple platformer, not much in the way of difficulty but enjoyable. Not sure it's worth it's pricetag but if you see it in a sale its certianly worth the grab.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040521211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1485216280}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058995287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1431, 'last_played': 1613274096}
review:
I've been playing through this game for a few weeks as a tester, and even though most of my time was spent running into walls/enemies/empty space making sure everything worked, I've played through several times for fun. 
The music is great. If you were a fan of Brawl in the Family or Tadpole Treble, the music is by the same guy. 
The platforming sections are full of nostalgia, with controls feeling like a game I would've enjoyed back in the SNES/Genesis era, and a difficulty to match. 
The writing is witty, and most of the time rather humorous. Even the serious lines manage to be entertaining.
Personally, I like the graphics, and the animations look pretty smooth. I don't feel I need to extend upon this, though, since you can just take a look at the screenshots to decide that for yourself. 
Overall, it's been a very enjoyable game, which I find has a pretty high replay value. I mean, I was testing it and I'm still playing it willingly afterwards!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014817640', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1485259344}
review:
Nefarious et un bon jeu d'action aventure avec un très bon gameplay, les graphismes sont plutôt cool j'ai bien ce look un peu BD, par contre je trouve la musique moyenne. J'ai trouvé quelle devenait vite agaçante et répétitive.

Ce que j'ai aimé dans Nefarious ces que pour une fois on est le méchant qui va kidnapper les princesses et non pas les sauver j'ai cependant quelque réticence pour le moment j'ai joué 1 heure et j'ai déjà réussi à capturer 2 princesses sur les 5 alors que je me suis embêté sur la 2ème bosse pendant 10/15 minutes. J'attends de voir comment va évoluer l'histoire du jeu si après avoir capturé les 5 princesses il y a autre chose à faire ou non car si ce n'est pas le cas je ne donne pas plus de 3 à 4 heures de jeu.

Je ne suis pas très bon en anglais donc je n'ai pas pu tout comprendre de l'histoire juste quelques phrases mais le si peut m'a fait rire je pense que quelqu'un de douer en anglais pourra passer un très bon moment en plus du jeu.

Je n'ai pas non plus grand-chose à dire sur le jeu car non il n'est pas mauvais, mais il n'est pas non plus exceptionnel ces un bon jeu oui ! Mes pas le jeu de l'année pour moi. À acheter en solde.

édite : 
J'ai rejoué 35 minutes depuis hier et j'ai eu le temps de refaire 3 stages plus j'avance dans le jeu plus je me dis qu'il est moyen :/ à faire à suivre je vous tiendrai au courant de mon avancer et modifierai cette Éva en fonction.

Les boss que j'ai rencontrés après ne sont vraiment pas dure à tuer et leur technique est facile à trouver.

https://youtu.be/0rzsq_uKUhM

author: {'steamid': '76561198102268939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1485271576}
review: This game is avarage, good sometimes bad the others. I really do like the concept. But it is the sounds that gets me mad, the boss fights lack quality, the sounds, the lack of sounds really irritates and breaks, what would've been a great boss fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064320788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1485378534}
review:
I like Taranto's Brawl In The Family comics and musics, so I was a bit biased when I bought this game. I'll try to be objective by saying it's a good game, with big strengths and tolerable issues.

First, the visuals are gorgeous, a lot of effort has been put into the characters and background. The music is good, though a bit too slow-paced sometimes (and the cuts between loops have been unacceptable since the last two decades) and the sound effects lack punch. Writing is more clever than I expected from a a deliberately cliché story. The gameplay is solid, running, jumping and punching feels nice and fun. I've only done three levels so far, but I still feel like it's not difficult enough - and when it is, it's for wrong reasons, like enemies attacking from offscreen, or clunky controls during the reverse boss fights. I think the clunkiness is intended, but it still spoils what is otherwise an interesting concept.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041354552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1485210456}
review: This is what mighty no. 9 SHOULD have been.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150719385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2031, 'last_played': 1505284127}
review:
Nefarious is a joy from start to finish. Fun platforming levels, inventive "reverse boss fights" where you get to pilot the boss mechs against the heroes, humorous dialogue with lovable characters, and a kickin' soundtrack courtesy of Brawl in the Family creator Matthew Taranto. This game's definitely worth the price of admission, and then some.

Come for the novelty of playing as the villain. Stay for the addictive gameplay and surprisingly gripping story. Nefarious is one game that I wholeheartedly recommend to any platforming fan!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083758317', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1485223985}
review: Great game, soundtrack is awesome. Controls take a min or two to figure out if your useing a keyboard but thats a easy fix. I don't play many side scrollers but this one manages to balance frustration and fun pretty well. The back and forth between Crow, his minions, his kidnap victims and even his rivals(Be they other bad guys or worthless heros) are quite amuseing. If you ever thought villians like Eggman or Dr. Wily were something to aspire to this might just be the game your looking for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034883739', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1489810671}
review:
Before you read any further, please note that this game only gets a half-hearted recommendation from me. It's certainly not a terrible game or anything - it is good. But it's not really great, either. Just kind of... average good.

Like, ok, so the art looks fantastic. The game is downright gorgeous, as you can see from the screenshots. And the writing for the story is pretty top-notch as well, and the game has some very creative moments involving the story. But as for the gameplay? Well, it's not *bad* or anything, it serves its purpose. But its not super entertaining. Once you upgrade your health one or two times, the levels become very trivial (except for the final level which spikes up in difficulty so far it feels like slamming into a brick wall). And the reverse boss fights - which were easily the thing I was looking forwards to the most, mind you - were a bit of a letdown. They all controlled a bit clunkily, and the one where you punch the ground gets special mention for being incredibly frustrating to control. Not to mention the heroes you're supposed to be fighting are very, VERY predictable, and as a result not difficult at all to fight.

But, in my opinion, the game's biggest sins come from its sound design. Now, the music on its own is all fine - I love Taranto's work, usually. This time around, however, the tracks sound... lacking. I'm not quite sure how to put it other than that. They feel like they needed maybe a couple more passes to make them something truly spectacular. On top of that, most of the time the tracks are far too sweeping and slow paced to fit the fast paced, action-y feel of the game. Also they commit the unforgivable sin of improper looping - instead of seamless loops (which have clearly been composed into the tracks), they fade out after about 2 loops and then start over at the beginning. As a sound designer myself, I cannot forgive that. It's just lazy.

Overall, this game feels... unfinished. The sound design all sounds kind of work in progress, there's a lot of areas where the game feels a bit unpolished (no death animations, no flashy animations for defeating heroes (hell, not even any dialogue for that), things that clearly should have sound effects not having them, etc.).

I still reccomend the game. For what it's worth, it's a good, servicable product. Just don't expect anything great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332651358', 'num_games_owned': 31, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1485181348}
review:
I had the honor to review this game live on my stream thanks to the dev team who hooked me up with a key! 

This game is something special! 
Not only does it look beautiful with its obviously hand drawn graphics, but the music puts on the finishing touches to make the whole game feel like a well orchestrated experience. 
I got into this game expecting a simple platformer, but after the first level got surprised by the extensive and beautifully written dialouge. After a while I started caring for the characters which I didn't think i would tbh! 
Gameplay wise this game is a blast, with all its upgrades it has something for every playstyle! 

If you are looking for a game that doesn't take itself or the gerne it's in too seriously, while having lots of well rounded characters, get Nefarious!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013102319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1522489883}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079229831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1541171012}
review:
ELECOM製のパッドとUnityの相性が悪いのか
JC-U3613Mだと全然動きませんが、ロジクールのF310なら大丈夫です。

オプションがボリューム調節ぐらいしかなく
フルスクリーンをAlt+Enterで強制的に切り替えると
バグります。早く何とかしてくれ。

勧善懲悪的なストーリーを逆の立場から…ってのは
国内でもそれほど珍しくない題材ですが
主人公がカッコつけてるけどちょっと間抜けそうなノリ(日本一ソフトウェア的とでも言いましょうか)と
バリエーション豊かなボス側プレイが気になったので買いました。
まだ序盤ですが、さらった姫やナイト役との掛け合いがグダグダで楽しいです。

姫をさらう道中は近接パンチとグレネードを武器に戦う
比較的シンプルなプラットフォームアクションです。
ここは個人的にマウス照準+キーボードより
ある程度角度固定でいいからゲームパッドで操作したかったですね。
難度は先に進むと結構急に上がったりします。
雪のステージは雑魚の投げてくる斧が痛かったり
姫をキャプチャーしてからは強制移動+ジャンプゲーになったり…
死んでもすぐチェックポイントから再開できるので
そんなストレスたまらないですけど。
道中に時間制限有りでいいので
ボスメカを使える要素があれば
もっと面白くなりそうなのは惜しいですね。

売りのボスバトルはまさしく醍醐味ですが
でかいなりに操作にクセがあって
小さいヒーローを狙う難しさってのを実感させてくれます
(この辺はヌルゲーにしなくて正解だと思います)
欲を言うなら、ステージごとに固定ではなくて
いくつか候補から選べたり、グレードアップ要素があっても
面白いと思うのですが。というか実装してくれまいか。

総じてアクションとしての面白さは並程度ですね。
やはり悪役主人公とどこかしらおかしい姫、ヒーローとのやり取りを
楽しむ方がメインな感じのゲームです。
買うならセールで気楽にプレイするのがおすすめです
